About Arch Mage

Male & Female ArchMage Sprites

▶ Arch Mage's are currently the highest job class in the Wizard path of Ragnarok Online.
It is Known that Arch mage's are the 4th job class after the 3rd job class Warlock.
▶ The Arch Mage class is only available to Norman Race.


▶ Lorewise it was to be said that the Warlock's have finally broken and surpassed the limit of there power and to obtain there true potential.
with the years of studies, readings of incantations and thousands of different kinds of spells from there spellbooks.
they have gained spell augmentations and reached there utmost Climax power, Obtaining power without the use of spellbooks
Bypassing the deafness with there new loud Spells that they have overcome the Magic immunities (GTB Effects)
With there new pure sheer of destructive power, they are now in full control of there magic abilities.

  • For more information about the Patch-Notes of 4th jobs in NovaRO, you can check it here:
https://www.novaragnarok.com/forum/news/pre-release-4th-job-patch-notes-188-r391/

About me


Do you want to be a mage too?~Hey you two stop skipping class! /omg (≖_≖ )

▶ Everyone would mostly call and known me with my in-game Alias as: Phrixi Felatine or Miyu (don't be afraid to say hi when you see me! :D)

▶ I've been playing Mage class for my entire livelihood, I got hooked into it and in that moment i fell in-love with magic for the rest of my life.
I was introduced to (Korean Ragnarok Online) since my childhood, Decided to moved to NovaRO (Nova Ragnarok Online) on late 2014-2015

▶ Nobody taught me how to play the class, Learned it with sticks and stones.
Experience was my best teacher and i learned alot after millions of trials and errors (Failure is Inevitable)
and now i am here to gladly share it with you! so you wouldn't have to go through the hardship as i did!

My Discord: 민정#7897
My Youtube Channel: I have a YouTube Channel! and it mostly contains Wizard / Magic Gameplays If you are interested feel free to check it out!
♥ https://www.Youtube.com/미유 (Mio) (I'm a NovaRO Content Creator and a Veteran Magic Class User) 

( My Youtube account has been put into a temporary halt and into private mode due to Gravity's DMCA and Banning of Streamers/youtubers. )

Stats

Did you know Dex stat Gives attack speed and Matk too?

[ Stats ]
STR 1-40 This Stat is only used for additional Weight. (Mages cannot by default carry heavy loads)
AGI 90-120 AtkSpd/ASPD will help you read spellbooks faster and a continous skill spam. (It reduces the Animation delays)
VIT 60-90 For more survivability , but you can Sacrifice some Vit for Agi or Luk. (atleast 120 if you're going for Fallen warrior manteau + Vicious Mind Aura)
INT 120+ Gives Matk, This is your Main Source of Damage as well as your SP battery (atleast 120 if you're going for Temporal int boots)
DEX 0-120+ Also Gives Matk, Investment in Dex also helps with Instant-Cast via stats,

you can get 0 dex if you're going for VCT Build via Gears/Equipments. (atleast 120 if you're going for Temporal dex boots)

LUK 1-90 Situational option, Only if you have some spare stat points for extra Resist and Matk.
[ 4th Job Trait Stats ]
POW 0 Mages does not deal nor Scale with physical damage therefore they will not benefit from this.
STA 0-97 Mages aren't tanky but may put to good use for Hybrid Builds to reduce Physical damage.
WIS 0-97 again Mages aren't tanky but may put to good use for Hybrid Builds to reduce Magic damage.
SPL 97-100 Primary Core Stat which gives you most damage every 3 points (100 SPL gives = 34 S.MATK)
CON 97 Secondary Core Stat Which also gives you damage but for every 5 points (97 CON gives = 20 S.MATK)
CRT 0 Mages Skills or Magic in general does "not" Crit and so they will not benefit from this stat

Stats

★ Strength (STR) [Optional]
▷ This Stat is mainly used for increasing the Weight Limit (Aside from Gym Passes ofcourse), It also helps with Masquerade resistance as well for PvP/WoE. If you can spare some points for it, it's nice to have 10-40 STR at most.

★ Agility (AGI) [Important]
▷ This Stat reduces ASPD delays and adds +1 Flee and increases ASPD for every point. Additionally, (every 5 points in AGI adds 1 SoftDEF) Raises Attack speed, which makes a huge difference in your skill spam, For most builds, [90+ AGI or Higher is recommended] and I advised to have at least 175+ ASPD and Above to remove the delay.
it would also reduces the duration of Masquerades for PvP/WoE.

★ Vitality (VIT) [Optional]
▷ This Stat raises your Max HP by +1% and the effectiveness of potions for every point. Since Mages have the lowest HP modifier amongs classes (Ofcourse not worst than Super novice (SN), and tend to die pretty easily if left alone in both PvE and PvP situations, my advised is to run at least [70-90+ total VIT].
it would also protects us against Crystallization, Freezing and Mandragora Howling for PvP/WoE.

★ Intelligence (INT) [Important]
▷ This Stat directly raises your MATK by +1.5 per point, main source of sp pool and regeneration, and it decreases your cast time, It's going to be the our Core stat to get Damage, it is recommended to get [120+ INT], (130 if you're going for stat instant-Cast) it would also help reduce with the Sleep, Deep Sleep and Oblivion Curse duration.

★ Dexterity (DEX) [Important]
▷ This Stat helps you to reduce cast time, but it also raises your ASPD by a small amount, and your MATK by 1/5 therefore it is ideal to have your DEX at multiples of 5. my advised is to run at a minimum of [90-100+ Dex and a maximum of 120-130 Dex] (130 if you're going for stat instant-Cast) (0 if you're going for VCT% gears instant-Cast) it would also help reduce with the Freezing duration.

★ Luck (LUK) [Optional]
▷ This Stat on every 3 points of LUK gives an additional +1 MATK, which makes it a very viable option to gain some MATK at later levels. Raising your INT from 120 to 130 would require you to use 340 stat points and would net you +15 MATK, while raising LUK from 1 to 30 would cost you only 86 stat points, and raise your MATK by +10. Glass Cannon and damage oriented builds usually have 30 or 60 LUK, depending on the player's taste.

4th Job's New Trait Status tab

Traits

★ Power (POW) [Useless]
▷ (As i mentioned above , we have no use nor benefit for this stat so best to avoid it as much as possible)
Status physical attack increases by 5 per 1 point.
P.ATK increases by 1 per 3 points.

★ Stamina (STA) [Optional]
▷ This Trait stat increases physical resistance (RES)
Not entirely Recommended but alternatively useful for Hybrid Builds.
RES increases by 1 per 1 point.
RES increases by 5 per 3 points.

★ Wisdom (WIS) [Optional]
▷ This Trait stat increases magic resistance (MRES)
Not entirely Recommended but alternatively useful for Hybrid Builds.
MRES increases by 1 per 1 point.
MRES increases by 5 per 3 points.

★ Spell (SPL) [Important]

▷ This Trait stat is our Primary Stat and it increases status magic attack and Spell Magic Attack (S.MATK)
Status Magic Attack increases by 5 per 1 point,
S.MATK increases by 1 per 3 points.

★ Concentration (CON) [Important]
▷ This Trait stat is our Secondary Stat and it increases accuracy (HIT), evasion (FLEE), Power Attack (P.ATK) and Spell Magic Attack (S.MATK)
S.MATK increases by 1 per 5 points.

★ Creative (CRT) [Useless]
▷ (Same as POW As i mentioned above, we have no use nor benefit for this stat so best to avoid it as much as possible)
H.PLUS increases by 1 per 1 point.
C.RATE increases by 1 per 3 points.

[ About 4th Job Trait Stats ]

★ There are 6 main trait stats that a player can allocate towards:

(POW, STA, WIS, SPL, CON and CRT)

★ Each of these main trait stats can grant various sub-trait stats:

(P.ATK, S.MATK, RES, MRES, H.PLUS,and C.RATE)
★ Any levels from 200 and beyond will grant Trait Stats instead of the normal Primary Stats.
  • A max level 4th job (lvl-250) has 197 Trait Status Points to use.
  • Turning to 4th job gives you 7 Trait Status Points.
  • Then every level give you 3 Trait Status Points.
  • For every level that is divisible by 5 (Ex: 200, 205, 210…), you will get 7 trait stat points.
[ About 4th Job Sub-Trait stat ]

▶ Physical Power (P.ATK)

Final status physical attack and final equipment attack increases by %.

▶ Spell Magical Attack (S.MATK)

Final status magic attack and final equipment magic attack increases by %.

▶ Physical Resistance (RES)

Before calculating physical defense, it reduces normal physical damage taken by %. (Only up to 50%)

▶ Magic Resistance (MRES)

Before calculating the magic defense, it reduces the normal magic damage received by %. (Only up to 50%)

▶ Heal Plus (H.PLUS)

Increases the final heal recovery by %. This increase is applied after normal heal recovery increasing effects.

▶ Critical Rate (C.RATE)

Increases the critical damage percent by %.
  • New status system!

▶ When you reach to the 4th job level, status points for existing (STR , AGI , VIT , INT , DEX , LUK ) are not given. But new trait status points are given instead, and those six new status trait status stats are (POW, STA, WIS, SPL, CON and CRT). .

▶ Talent status points do not increase the amount of additional points gradually as the level increases. A certain point is given per level up, and bonus points are given for each specific unit level.

▶ Each new characteristic status has a fixed point investment cost of 1 point, unlike the existing status. gravity made it possible to check the point investment more intuitively.

Explanation

Power (POW)

Main Trait for Physical, melee and ranged, Damage Dealers.
⇒ Adds Power Attack (P.ATK) and Stat ATK (ATK).
⇒ Power Attack is a final % increase that boosts Weapon and Status Attack by that same value.
⇒ E.g.: 10 P.ATK means 10% of extra Weapon ATK (200 -> 220) and 10% of Status Attack (300 -> 330). 

Stamina (STA)

Main Trait for players that want more survival against physical damage.
⇒ Adds Resistance (RES).
⇒ Resistance works like Steel Body, as a percentage value, against the damage you would take, but before anything else.
⇒ Resistance has an hard cap on 50 points so anything above that means 0.
⇒ E.g.: 2000 damage with 25 RES means that you will take instead 1500 damage as the initial damage taken (2000 * (100% - 25%) = 2000 * 75% = 2000 * 0.75 = 1500),
then you do the usual calculations for Hard and Soft DEF. 

Wisdom (WIS)

Main Trait for players that want more survival against magical damage.
⇒ Wisdom works like Steel Body, as a percentage value, against the damage you would take, but before anything else.
⇒ Wisdom has an hard cap on 50 points so anything above that means 0.
⇒ E.g.: 2000 damage with 25 WIS means that you will take instead 1500 damage as the initial damage taken (2000 * (100% - 25%) = 2000 * 75% = 2000 * 0.75 = 1500), then you do the usual calculations for Hard and Soft MDEF. 

Spell (SPL)

Main Trait for Magical Damage Dealers.
⇒ Adds Spell Magic Attack (S.MATK) and Magical Attack (MATK).
⇒ Spell Magic Attack is a final % increase that boosts the total of your MATK by that same value.
⇒ E.g.: 10 S.ATK means 10% of extra MATK (2000 -> 2200). 

Concentration (CON)

Secondary Trait for players that need HIT to deal damage.
Also useful for players that have extra points to spend somewhere and want a bit of extra damage.
⇒ CON adds HIT, FLEE, P.ATK, and S.MATK.
⇒ It's very useful if your skills depend on HIT to cause damage or you want a bit of extra FLEE to dodge some physical damage.
⇒ It's very easy to get absurd numbers on those two thanks to it. 

Creative (CRT)

Main Trait for players that have skills that deal Critical Hits or play Heal builds.
⇒ CRT adds Critical Rate (C.RATE) and Heal Plus (H.PLUS).
C.RATE
⇒ C.RATE boosts the 40% extra damage, the initial boost, of a physical hit, long or short ranged, for being critical.
⇒ If your critical hits did 1000 damage non-crits, they do 1400 when they do Critical Hits (1000 + 40% = 1000 * 1.4 = 1400).
⇒ If you have 10 C.RATE, they do 1500 instead. The 40% becomes a 50% bonus (40% + 10% from the 10 C.RATE).
⇒ This doesn't stack with Critical Damage modifiers, those still apply in a different slot of modifiers, which means that they multiply with this.
H.PLUS
⇒ H.PLUS boosts the heal done by healing skills after all the other mods are taken into consideration.
⇒ If you use a healing skill and it heals 20000 HP, when you add 20 H.PLUS you will heal 24000 HP instead.

Activity Point (AP)

If you die , your stored ap will be gone, Hmph!

Activity Point

▶ Activity Point (AP) is a new resource mechanic exclusive to 4th job skills.
It is visible to your HUD and it can be seen under your SP Bar (a third resource pool will appear)
By Default a Unfilled AP pool will be shaded in Transparent black and a filled AP pool bar will be colored in beige

▶ Ragnarok's version of Super/Special Moves. ,every 4th job have skills that build up AP (like a few AP per cast of specific skills) and Special skills that consume AP that cost like (150~200 AP) Per Cast.

The idea is you use the skills that charge AP and once you've gotten enough AP from charging it, you use up a ton of it for one big super special skill. A lot of them are really disgustingly strong, but some of them are pretty special, like Archmage changing the functions of their skills called Climax.

AP Recovery
AP Resource Bar
  • There are usually two Super / Special skills that consumes majority of your AP
  • The maximum amount of AP you can hold is 200 AP regardless of class.
  • Each 4th job has skills that grant or generate AP. (You can check the skill's description) Keyword ▷ AP Recovery
  • Elemental Master's Activity Burn Skill can remove AP from an enemy user.
  • @showap Command Similar to @showsp, this will show the current AP for party members.


[ Update ]: Arch Mages new AP Recovery Skills now gives 2 AP per cast intead of 1 AP per cast.

▶ Example: Arch Mage's Frozen Slash Skill gives 2 AP per Cast (low cooldown)
▶ Example: Arch Mage's Climax Skill Consumes 150 AP per Cast (high cooldown)

Other Ways of gaining and losing AP

  • Dying resets AP to 50% / Half of your current AP and, unlike HP or SP, it does not regenerate passively but can get recovered from Healer NPC.
  • Healer NPC can be accessed anywhere via using a  Cell Phone (under Utilities)
  • When you die or enter a PvP or WoE Siege maps, you will lose all your stored AP.
  • There are also two other methods of Obtaining and Sharing AP aside from the Healer NPC. 
First one is via Elemental Master's  Increasing Activity Ap Generating Skill
Second one is via Summoner/Doram's  Kisul Rampage Ap Generating Skill.

ArchMage's AP Skills

▶List of all of ArchMage's AP Related skills and there AP Recovery/Consume Amount.

  • Mystery Illusion = Recovers 4 AP
  • Crimson Arrow = Recovers 1 AP
  • Frozen Slash = Recovers 1 AP
  • Storm Cannon = Recovers 1 AP
  • Rock Down = Recovers 1 AP
  • Climax = Consumes 150 AP
  • Astral Strike = Consumes 150 AP

[ Note ]: Currently in NovaRO Arch Mages AP Recovery Skills gives 1 AP per cast intead of 2 AP per cast.

Activating Premium AP Healer

▶To Activate, talk to Joy to the Main Office.(main_office 212, 181)Copied! Enabling options will automatically grant you the effect for the price stated every time you use the Healer in any town. Heal AP, for 25,000z. (5 minute cooldown between uses)

Reference of AP Reduction in Death: https://www.novaragnarok.com/forum/news/surprise-patch-notes-1925-r397/

Casting Time / Variable Cast Time / Fixed Cast Time / Cast Delay

I love Dex and Int, they help me cast faster!㇏(>ᵥᵥ<)ノ

Casting Time

▶ Cast Time is the time it takes to perform a skill, It is always an important factor when considering on builds (Specially for Mage Classes) whether that be stats, skill choice and/or equipment options.

  • In Renewal, cast time is composed and splitted into two parts: Variable Cast Time = VCT and Fixed Cast Time = FCT. Skills normally have a mixture of both, but can sometimes have only fixed cast time or vice versa.
(The normal unit of measurement is Seconds.)
  • If a skill has no base Cast Time or modifiers reduce the effective Cast Time to 0 or less, no cast gauge appears and this phase is skipped entirely.
(If there is no Cast Time it is then executed instantaneously.)
  • During Cast Time animation, the character cannot move, attack, or use other skills, But you can use consumables. If the character takes damage during Cast Time, the skill that has been casted will get canceled. Exceptions to that are: wearing a Phen Card or Sweet Nightmare Card, being Devotioned by a Crusader type Class.

▶ Casting Bar is indicated by a "Progress Gauge" it is located above the character's head, which also sometimes called "Cast Bar"(CB) for short. A gauge appears above the character's head, This is visually shown with an empty black bar, which fills green over time as Cast Time proceeds. When the cast bar is completely green, Cast Time ends. Some skills do not have a cast bar, even though they have a casting time, such as Sight and Quagmire

[with VCT and FCT reductions] [without VCT and FCT reductions]

Variable Cast Time

  • Variable cast time is one of the most flexible to reduce and to attain no cast status, we have several options for VCT modifications. The general formula of it is:
Final VCT = Skill VCT × ( Stat Reduction )  × ( 1 - [ Sum of Percentage VCT Decreases ] ) seconds
Stat Reduction =  1 − SQRT ( [ DEX × 2 + INT ] ÷ 530 )
  • To reduce all Variable cast time with only Stats, You need a combination of DEX and INT so DEX ×2 and INT equal at least 530 ((DEX × 2 + INT) = 530).
 DEX × 2 + INT = 530
  • Alternatively you can reduce all Variable cast time via Gears/Equipments/Pets

Every Equipments and Gears that are Labeled with "Reduce Variable Cast time by #% are Stackable untill 100% (100% = Insta cast which is equivalent to 530 Stat points)


( It's up to you on how you want to reach it, but i recommend getting both Dex and Int to reduce the expenses on skill points to Attain 0 VCT efficiently )
These are some examples on how all Variable Cast Time could be reduced via stats:

  • INT 530
  • DEX 265
  • INT 170 and DEX 180
  • INT 190 and DEX 170

VCT reduction with via stats + vct% will be multiplicative instead .
______________________________________________________________
Note (1): you can attain 0 VCT either by stats alone or percentage reductions alone, but not in some combination of the two due to the nature of the VCT formula.
Note (2): Poem Of Bragi's cast time reduction stacks with this kind of reduction, while Suffragium,  Isilla Card and Intense Telekinesis does not.

Example: A player casts a 10s variable cast time skill with 160 INT and 160 DEX, while wearing gears with a total of -90% VCT.

  • Stat Reduction = 1 - SQRT ( [ 160 × 2 + 160 ] ÷ 530 ) ≈ 0.048
  • Final VCT = 10s × 0.048 × ( 1 - 0.90 ) = 0.048s


You can check your total Variable Cast time reductions with @Battlestats Command or @BS for short

  • Stats: Total Variable Cast Time reductions via Stats
  • Statuses: Total Variable Cast Time reductions via Skills
  • Bonuses: Total Variable Cast Time reductions via VCT% reduction in Gears / Equipments / Cards

List of Variable Cast Time Reductions

[ Variable Cast Time ]
Item Item Type Value Reduction Type Extra
 +9 Crown Of Deceit [1] [Headgear] 20% Percentage

[Refine >= 9]

After Cast Delay +5%
 +9 Ferlock's Manteau [1] [Garment] 35% Percentage

[Refine >= 12]

Variable Cast Time +5%
 +9 Vellum Arc Wand [Weapon] 50% Percentage

[Refine >= 9]

Fixed Cast Time -0.2 Seconds
Kathryne Keyron Card [Card] 12% Percentage
Variable Cast Time +1% Per refine
 Airship's Cloak [1] [Garment] 20% Percentage None
 Automatic Armor B-type [1] [Armor] 15% Percentage None
 Automatic Engine wing B-type [1] [Garment] 7% Percentage

[Refine >= 7]

Variable Cast Time 7%
 Automatic Engine wing A-type [1] [Garment] 15% Percentage

When equipped with Automatic Leg B-type: Variable casting time by 15%.

 Blue Dragon Plate [1] [Armor] 32% Percentage

Variable casting time by 4% per 15 base Int.

 Dex Soutane [1] [Armor] 20% Percentage  Dex Blessing

Variable casting time 10%

 Fallen Warrior Manteau [1] [Armor] 32% Percentage

If Int Stat point is 120 = 32% Variable Cast time

 Vicious Mind Aura [Headgear] 32% Percentage

Combos with Fallen Warrior Manteau

 Illusion Battle Chip R [1] [Accessory] 10% Percentage

Can be Enchanted with  Automatic Module (Spell)

Fixed Cast Time

▶ Fixed cast time is in a more complicated side when taken in account than VCT, being totally unaffected by stats. The formula for FCT is as follows: 

Final FCT = ( Skill FCT - [ Sum of Flat FCT Mods] ) × ( 1 - [ Max of Percentage FCT Decrease ] + [ Max of Percentage FCT Increase ] )

▶ Fixed cast time can only be reduced by buffs from a skill, an item consumable and from equipments.

Percentage based reductions do not stack here, only the strongest one is applied.

Percentage based reduction effects do not stack no matter the source. If a player is under multiple FCT percentage reduction effects, only the highest value :will take effect.
Highest Percentage will overwrite and hinder the lower ones useless.


  • Example (1): Having Radius at level 3 reduces your fixed cast time by 20% (Warlock Skill), but your Archbishop friend casts Lv5 Sacrament on you, which reduces your fixed cast time by 50%. Since only the strongest one applies, your fixed cast time will be reduced only by 50% and will overwrite the 20% from radius
However, fixed (flat) reduction does stack with percentage reduction, and also with itself. This makes it possible to reduce fixed cast time to zero.
  • Example (2): A player has a headgear compounded with  Fenrir Card equipped and then has Lv5 Sacrament cast upon them. As Sacrament's bonus of 50% is less than Fenrir's 70%, Sacrament does nothing, and the player's FCT reduction remains at 70%.
  • Example (3): A player has two  Buwaya Agimat Tattoos equipped. Their FCT would be reduced by 7%, not 14%, as it does not stack (but they would get MATK +14% as expected).
  • Example (4): A player has one  Buwaya Agimat Tattoo equipped and is under the effect of Lv5 Sacrament. As Sacrament's bonus of 50% reduction is the larger bonus compared to Buwaya's 7%, the player has their FCT reduced by 50%.


▶ However, flat reductions like:

 Temporal DEX Boots (0.5s FCT reduction) and  Ceremonial Crown GC (0.2s FCT reduction) = 0.7 FCT reduction
or
 Automatic Leg B-type (0.8s FCT reduction) and  Brilliant Light Sapphire Ring +  Brilliant Light Sapphire Necklace (0.2s FCT reduction) = 1.0s FCT reduction
or
 Magic Essence Lv. 5 (0.5s FCT reduction) and  Casting Onyx [G] (0.5s FCT reduction) = 1.0s FCT reduction
or
 Illusion Morpheus Hood (0.5s FCT reduction) and  Illusion Thorn Staff of Darkness (Total/Sum Refine is 22 or higher) = 0.5 FCT reduction
Do stack with other flat reduction effects. Stacking flat reductions is the only possible way of removing a skill's fixed cast time because there exists no single source of 100% FCT reduction. The only exception are the Oboro / Kagerou classes, who have the skill 16th Night which removes fixed cast time entirely.

[Fun Facts]:

  • Soul Expansion:This skill doesn't have any FCT (you could ditch fct gears and wear damage gears for more damage on this build)
  • Energy Coat: This skill only has FCT and it's the highest FCT requisite amongs Warlock skills (a big whopping 5.0 secs of FCT)
  • Mystical Amplification: This skill now has an Un-reducable amount of fixed cast time (Impossible to Instant-Cast by any means)

Cast Delay

Cast Delay
  • After you use a skill, there is a certain amount of time where you can't use the same skill, or other skills. This is what is called Cast Delay.
  • Delay is a relatively obscure mechanic that was mostly ignored in Pre-Renewal. In Renewal, however, it can be separated into two: Cast Delay and Cooldown
  • It is a delay that prevents all skills from being cast. Some skills, such as Magnificat, have longer Cast delay, while others have shorter ones. This delay can be reduced by certain equipment like  Expert Ring and  Kiel D-01 Card, and by a Bard's Poem Of Bragi skill.
There are technically 3 types of Delays ( After Cast Delay , Skill Delay , Animation Delay )
  • The ability to spam one skill, is limited by the highest of those three factors.
That means generally, if you are able to reduce the After Cast Delay of any skill that has no Skill Delay, to a value smaller then it's Animation Delay, ASPD or "Animation Delay Cancel will help to reuse the skill more frequently.
  • The effect of ASPD or "Animation Delay Cancel" greatly varies between skills. As a general rule of thumb, enemy-targeted offensive skills usually have ASPD-dependent animation delays, while ground-targeted and support skills usually have fixed animation delays, but there is no particular hard-and-fast rule for this. That means though, that if your skill's Animation Delay is not really affected by ASPD, "Animation Delay Cancel" becomes more viable.
Some skills do lose their Animation Delay entirely when Instant Cast (265 Dex, or 100% Cast Time reduction) is achieved. Examples are  Acid Demonstration and  Increase Agility. One would conclude that this means their reusability greatly increases, but thats weirdly enough, not the case. The reusability for  Acid Demonstration, with  Poem Of Bragi, is best at 264 dex (with an animation) and not 265. (Same behavior to RK's  Dragon Breath)

Cooldown

  • On the other hand, Cooldown (also known as Hard Cooldown) is a delay that prevents certain single skills from being recast immediately. Not all skills have Cooldowns, but some, such as a Sura's Guillotine Fist, have a long Cooldown. This Cooldown is not affected by Poem Of Bragi, and is only affected by very specific items, for example: Tornado Axe reduces the cooldown of Mechanic's  Axe Tornado, and  Bow of Storms reduces the cooldown of Maestro/Wanderer's Severe Rainstorm

Here are some Examples of equipments that can reduce cooldown on certain skills : 

( Old Magic Stone): Reduces the cooldown of  Crimson Rock by 1 second. Reduces the cooldown of  Crimson Rock) by an additional 0.1 seconds per refine level.

( Gravitional Staff): Reduces  Gravitational Field Cooldown by 2 sec.

( Blue Crystal Staff): Reduces  Jack Frost cooldown by 1 second.

( Warlock Shadow Book +  Warlock Shadow Glove): Reduces  Life Drain cooldown by 1 second. and Reduces  Earth Strain cooldown by 4 second.

Animation Delay

  • Animation delay is the amount of time it takes your character to go through the motion of its cast (e.g. Heal), attack (e.g Meteor Assault),
    or throw animation (e.g. Acid Demonstration), which can be reduced by higher ASPD or a technique called "Animation Delay Cancel" (*). Another skill cannot be initiated, until you have finished the animation for a previous one.
  • You would most likely notice this early on when you realize that Mystical amp and Soul drain will get you stuck to an Animation lock until you can cast and move again
You can either use the  First Aid Skill, @Refresh or Re-Read  Reading Spell Book Skill afterwards to bypass the lock animations.

[ Pro Tips ]
▶ You can bypass Comet's Animation Lock Delay Release by either having a ping(ms) of 200ms-300ms and above or by using the following:

  •  Magnifier
  •  Abacus in Mouth
  •  Agility Scrolls
  •  Guarana Candy
  •  Fox Ear Ribbons (Fox Transformation)
  • and by using the @Refresh Command as well 
However  Crimson Rock and  Jack Frost and  Chain Lightning Doesn't get affected by this weird release lock behavior 
 (You can release all the stored spell smoothly without any hinderance/problem)

After Cast Delay

  • After Cast Delay is a skill specific, fixed amount of time after using a skill, during which no other skill can be initiated, indicated by a grey-colored pawnprint over all skills. Poem Of Bragi and gears that reduces "after-cast" or "re-use" delay will shorten this time. However Even at 100% reduction at the Savage Coast map (MH), this delay is hard-capped at about 200ms+ or 5 skills per second.
  • We have a fairly high amount of (ACD) requirements on some certain builds , or builds that can be executed better on faster spam rate.


List of Notable skills and its required After-Cast Delay to fully utilize the skill spam.
Skills that isn't listed means the skill has longer cooldown or doesn't need (ACD) at all

▶ Magician

▶ Warlock

▶ Arch Mage

 Rock Down (40% ACD)

You Can Check your total ACD by using (@BS) or (@Battlestats) Command in-game, it should be labeled as (Global Cooldown Reduction XX%)

Skill Delay

  • Skill Delay prevents you from using a particular skill again, but you can use other skills. It's the dark grey shaded vision over an individual skill, and is not reduced by anything. For instance, consider the Endure skill. You can't use it again, even if the effect runs out, for several seconds, but this would be disastrous if you couldn't use other skills in the interim. Only reuse of Endure is prevented for the full duration.

Reading Spell Books / Releasing / Mind Slots

Hmmm which spellbook should i get? (ーー; )

Reading Spell Book

  • This skill allows you to instantly cast there previously stored spells by Reading  Spellbooks, In which you can later on be released using the Release Skill.
  • There are a Total of 17 (Old Spell books) and 9 (New Spell books), the rest of the spellbooks was discontinued and forgotten.
  • Upon sealing a spell up or after you read the spellbook, its SP Cost is applied immediately.
  • Skills cast in this manner can be powered up by Mystical Amplification, as Release will not consume the effect like it did before.
  • Attempting to read a Spell Book for a skill the caster does not know will fail and put the caster to Sleep. (So make sure you have inputted skill points on those skills)

[ Old Behavior ] 

To store a spell, you have to have the specific spell book in your inventory, a Spell storing tab will appear , and choose which one you’d like to store. by left clicking it, Each spell book have their own “mind slot” cost – the more powerful the spell the more slots it’ll take.

[ New Behavior ] 

Now with the new Update with our new spellbooks, To store a spell, you still need to press and consume it to activate but you wont have the small spell storing tab anymore like its old behavior, now without that nasty tab from hindering us from spamming faster, it should gives us more time now in combat situation (It is Automatically stored once you read it)

Mind Slots

  • We have limited but efficient enough number of Mind Slots in which we can memorize spells, which is determined by Base Level, INT and the level of Freezing Spell] if the player has learned it. This determines how many skills they can keep memorized at any given time.
  • Note that this is an implicit mechanic. There is no visible indication of how many spells a player can memorize or has memorized.

However thanks to NovaEXT which is only exclusive to NovaRO, we can see visually see how many spells we can store
You can check this through the (@Battlestats) or (@BS) command in-game

Stored Comet at (@BS) / (@Battlestats)
Stored Crimson Rock at (@BS) / (@Battlestats)

______________________________________________________________

  • The amount of spells stored can be calculated by the following formula:

[ Old Formula ]

Slots = (4*Freezing Spell Lv) + floor(BLv/10) + floor(INT/10)

[ New Formula ]

(Increased mind slot per skill level from 4 to 8 (however the maximum number of memorized spell is 7 spells).

Slots = (8*Freezing Spell Lv) + floor(BLv/10) + floor(INT/10)

Releasing

▶ Inflicts MATK|Magic Damage to a single target one or multiple times by using the elemental orbs summoned through their respective skills (Fire, Water, Lightning, Stone). This skill can also be used to quickly let out one of the sealed spells at random through Reading Spell Book.

▶ For released ground spells like Storm Gust and Comet, the target will be the center of the Area of Effect. The exception to this is Earth Strain, where the location of the target only indicates the direction the spell will travel to. 

Lvl 1  Release = Releases the Stored Spells that you read from a  Spellbook
Lvl 2  Release = Releases Elemental orbs from  Summon Fire Ball  Summon Water Ball  Summon Lightning Ball  Summon Stone Ball

Always check your Release Level as they have different function on each level.

▶ There are new versions of these mage spellbooks 
but the lower ones got discontinued because of inefficiency and ineffectiveness

Purchasing Spell Books

  • You can purchase spell books at the Geffen Mage guild (geffen_in 174, 112)Copied!. from Lea after talking to Magic Book Master Velof.
  • Each Spell Book has a cost, dependent on the level of the Spell Book. Multiple payment options are offered, and the player only needs to select one. Regardless of the NPC's dialog, these books are effectively purchased and can be used indefinitely. Payment only applies to a single book; additional books, including those of the same level, require repurchase.

To obtain Ultimate Magic Books, you will have to complete the following quests: 

Cat Hand Services
Ring of the Wise King
Sapha's Visit
Ultimate Spellbooks Quest
Lea (Buying Spellbook Options)
Spell Book Rank Payment Options
[ Beginner ]
  • 10,000z
  • 2 Old Magicbook
  • 50 Worn Out Pages
[ Intermediate ]
  • 50,000z
  • 2 Old Blue Box
  • 9 Elunium
[ Superior ]
  • 200,000z ("Let me think" option)
  • 100,000z + 12 Fragment
  • 100,000z + 7 Oridecon
  • 100,000z + 1 Old Purple Box
[ Ultimate ]
  • 1,000,000z + Ultimate Spellbooks Quest

(Tip: Choosing Superior Magic Books and then the “Let me think” option will allow you to pay 200,000 zeny for the books instead of bringing items to her)

Mdef / Soft Mdef / Hard Mdef / Bypass Penetrations

What if we Odin enemies? that should reduce there mdef right?

Magic Defense

  • The total magical defense that is factored upon magic damage, which is generally based on MATK as whole or partially. However, there are exceptions.
  • To obtain the final damage,apply Hard MDEF first and then apply soft MDEF.

Soft Magic Defense

  • Soft magic defense, also known as "INT" magic defense, reduces incoming magic damage directly.
SoftMDEF      = INT + VIT ÷ 5 + DEX ÷ 5 + BaseLv ÷ 4
TotalSoftMDEF = [(SoftMDEF + BonusA) × (1 + BonusB ÷ 100)]
  • BonusA is the sum of additive bonuses.
  • BonusB is the sum of multiplicative bonuses.
  • Monsters use a different SoftMDEF formula.
SoftMDEF      = floor(Lvl ÷ 4) + floor (VIT ÷ 10) + floor(INT ÷ 5)

Hard Magic Defense

  • Hard m. defense, also known as "armor" or "equipment" m. defense reduces, incoming magic damage multiplicatively.
  • Hard m. defense has a base value of 0, and is increased by equipment, some skills, and items.
  • Damage after Hard MDEF = Damage × [(1000 + HardMDEF) ÷ (1000 + HardMDEF × 10)]

(For example, a player with a Hard MDEF of 60 will have incoming m. damage reduced by about ⅓, and a player with a Hard MDEF of 125 will have incoming damage reduced by half.)

(It is shown as A + B in the Status Window, where A represents the Soft Mdef and B represents the Hard Mdef.)

  • The Magical Defense(MDEF) system was revamped in the Renewal Update. HardDEF/MDEF is no longer limited into a 1-100 point system, with 100 being full immunity. Instead, the effect of HardMDEF is now reduced exponentially as the number goes up (i.e. the higher the number, the less effect every single point adds);
  • SoftDEF/MDEF which is mostly based on VIT and INT respectively, did not go through a lot of change from Pre-Renewal. They reduce damage subtractively, removing flat amounts from the final damage after the HardDEF/MDEF reductions are applied.
[ Effects of Hard MDEF on incoming damage ]

Bypassing MDEF

  • We all know that MDEF is any Magic class's big threat to our existance (They are the reason why magic classes were left behind years ago)
  • Gravity gave magic classes some love and introduced more gears for us to Bypass these walls (We can reach 100% bypass now)


Final MDEF = (Total_Mdef - Sum_MdefReduceValues) × (1 − Sum_MdefBypassPercent ÷ 100)

  • Total_Mdef = Total Hard MDEF shown in the Status Window.
  • Sum_MdefReduceValues = sum of flat values that reduce MDEF, like Odin Power.
  • Sum_MdefBypassPercent = sum of modifiers that bypass MDEF by a percent, like Expiatio.
  • For example, if a player has 25% MDEF Bypass from Expiatio buff, 20% MDEF Bypass from Tempest Shadow Accessories, and Odin Power Level 2 (-40 MDEF) is casted on an enemy with 100 Hard MDEF, the enemy's final MDEF is calculated as:
    • Final MDEF = (100 - 40) x (1 - (25+20) ÷ 100)

It may look complicated but it is as simple as you may think (Percentage given as how many % of damage will go through your enemy without gettin reduced) 

At 100% Full Bypass: we can unleash havoc with full damage without getting your damage reduced by any means.

Bypass Combo set

  • These are some Bypass sets that you may want to look into and bring in your Mage journey
[ All Bypass Equipments ]
  • Set 1

 Piercing Staff [2] = 10% Bypass to all race, 1% Bypass to all race per refine. (+15 PS would give 25% All Race Bypass)

  • Set 2

 Thorn Staff of Darkness = 1% Bypass to all race per refine. (+15 TSOD would give 15% All Race Bypass)

  • Set 3

 Illusion Thorn Staff of Darkness [2] = 3% Bypass to all race per refine. (+15 ITSOD would give 45% All Race Bypass)

  • Set 4

 Purified Knight's Shield [1] = It can have a maximum of 60% Bypass towards Normal or Boss monsters.

  • Set 5

 Magic Absorber [1] = It can have a maximum of 60% Bypass towards Normal or Boss monsters.

  • Set 6

 Drooping Neko Crew [1] = 10% Bypass when refined to atleast +7, 1% Bypass to all race per refine. (+12 DNC would give 22% All Race Bypass)

  • Set 7

 Ordinary Black Magician Hat [1] = 10% Bypass to Normal monsters, 2% Bypass to Normal monsters per refine. (+12 OBMH would give 34% Normal Bypass)

  • Set 8

 Wickebine's Black Cat Ears = 100% Bypass to all race when proc'ed. (5% Chance to proc per hit)

  • Set 9

 Wickebine's Black Cat Ears-LT = 100% Bypass to all race when proc'ed. (7% Chance to proc per hit)

  • Set 10

 Temporal Int Manteau [1] = 30% Bypass to Brute and Demon type Monsters (60% Bypass if paired with a Temporal Boots of int)

  • Set 11

 Grave Worm Card = 10% Bypass to All Race Monsters, Additional 2% per 4 refine rate.

  • Set 12

 High Wizard Card = 100% Bypass to Normal type Monsters.

  • Set 13

 Vesper Card = 30% Bypass to Boss type Monsters.

  • Set 14

 Lich Lord Card = 100% Bypass to all race. (only when paired with Royal Guard Ring)

  • Set 15

 Necromancer Card = 2% Bypass to all race.

  • Set 16

 Enhanced Necromancer Card = 2% Bypass to all race, Additional 1% enemy magic defense ignore/Pen for each 4 refines. (6% if Refined to +16)

  • Set 17

 Neo Punk Card +  Big Ben Card = Bypass 50% to Formless and Demon type monsters (Must wear both to take effect)

  • Set 18

 Nightmare Arclouse Card +  Ancient Mimic Card = Bypass 50% to Brute and Undead type monsters (Must wear both to take effect)

Diminishing Returns / Stacking Modifiers

You B-baka! Stop Using +15 Knife (x4 Bio5 Kathryne keyron Card)  !( ・⌓・｀)

Diminishing Returns

  • Diminishing returns governs the gradual loss of effectiveness of a stats or modification on continual use or if hoarded in huge pair of stacks. Simply put, the more you abuse a stat or a modification, the less effective it becomes.
it is to encourage variation in gameplay, many games make player effort have less and less effect after a certain point. This reduction of usefulness in invested actions and Resources
  • Gravity inverts this in before its renewal patch for its offensive stats; while the cost to increase a stat went up as it got higher, you'd get bonus damage when you reach certain points (for example, every 10 str points gave a melee attack bonus). This bonus grows as you reached higher and higher stats, to the point that oftentimes that it was worth paying more for the higher stat (so you'd have less total stats), if it meant reaching a damage bonus. The renewal patch changes this behavior.


Visuals of having too much effort in one thing returns in negative results

So How does Diminishing Return works now in Ragnarok Online?

  • The law of diminishing marginal returns states that, at some point, adding an additional factor of production results in smaller increases in output.
In a Much simplier sense: "Too much of something is bad and will result in more expenses and terrible or Lesser outcome"
So that means, in the context of Ragnarok Online, the following example is more obvious and experienced by all characters:


On the topic of Raising Stats (Str, Agi, Vit, Int, Dex, Luk)

  • Raising a stat in the range of 1-10 (Output) costs 2 points (Factor of Production).
  • Raising a stat in the range of 81-90 (Output) costs 10 points (Factor of Production).
  • Raising a stat in the range of 126-130 (Output) costs 36 points (Factor of Production).

As you increase the same stat by an additional point, you'll be allocating more and more points(factor of production), to only have gained 1 more point of the same stat(output). This is one CLEARER way of explaining how diminishing returns works in RO.

  • Whether you think 1 more point in the 126-130 range is more "worth it" than the 1-10 range of another stat is up to the individual. but if you need to invest on a gear that gives another battle stat is entirely up you.

Stacking Modifiers

These are the different types of modifiers: (Race, Size, Element Property, Boss, Normal, Skill)
  • General rule of thumb

Prioritize in scattering the modifiers to different types rather than stacking 1 type of modifier multiple times, "Diminishing returns" kicks in after having multiple and copy of one type.

Altho there are alot of modifiers now that will get you pass 100% in total, but that is still fine as long as you balance and even it out with other modifiers 

(eg. 120% Neutral propery + 50% Medium + 30% Boss) is better than (eg. 200% Neutral Property +10% Medium + 10% Boss)
Modifier Bonuses in-game using (@BS) / (@Battlestats)

______________________________________________________________

Modifier Good and Bad-o-meter

▶ Given that in Late-Game Status you'll be able to reach a huge amount of Modifiers that would possible pass 200% easily thanks to better and newly Released Cards and Equipments on future episodes, it is safe to say that you can go as much as 200%+ on a each single mod.
As long as you balanced it out evenly with others first.

▶ Remember that diminishing returns start right after the first redundant card.

  • Raising a Racial Modifier in this amount: 100% -> 200% -> 300% -> 400% -> 500%+
  • Raising a Elemental Modifier in this amount: 100% -> 200% -> 300% -> 400% -> 500%+
  • Raising a Size Modifier in this amount: 100% -> 200% -> 300% -> 400% -> 500%+
  • Raising a Special Modifier in this amount: 100% -> 200% -> 300% -> 400% -> 500%+
  • Raising a Skill Modifier in this amount: 100% -> 200% -> 300% -> 400% -> 500%+


▷ The Amount of Effectiveness in each tier: Good -> Okay -> Bad -> Worst -> Futile💀

Modifier Types

Race: (Angel, Demon, Demi-Human, etc.)
Element: (Wind, Fire, Water, etc.)
Size: (Small, Medium, Large)
Special: (MVP, Mini-bosses, Non-boss)
Skill: (Comet, Soul Expansion, etc.) [Skill Modifiers are treated as "Final" Modifiers.]
Modifiers of the same type are being added, while different modifiers are multiplied.

To determine the damage output of your card combo, just follow this formula:

Race x Element x Size x Special = Increase Damage% 

 (1)   x    (1)    x   (1)   x   (1)   =  1 or 100%

______________________________________________________________

We’ll be using these cards as example:

  • Zakudam Card [Race] – Increase damage on Demi-Human monster by 10%.
  • Magic Poison Plaga Card [Element] – Increases Neutral Property damage by 30%.
  • Mutated White Knight Card [Size] – Increase damage inflicted on Medium and Large size monster by 25%. MATK + 15

We’ll be using (Demi-Human / Player) as our Target:

  • Properties:[ Demi-Human , Medium , Neutral ]

Tip: Players are considered as Demi-Human in race and medium size monsters and are neutral property by default

Using the cards above, we'll have the following formula when you compound those cards in your 4-slotted weapon:

  • Zakudam Card, Zakudam Card, Zakudam Card, Zakudam Card
(1 + 0.1 + 0.1 + 0.1 + 0.1) x (1) x (1) x (1) = 1.40 or 140% Increased in Damage
  • Zakudam Card, Zakudam Card, Zakudam Card, Mutated White Knight Card
 (1 + 0.1 + 0.1 + 0.1) x (1) x (1 + 0.25) x (1) = 1.625 or 162.5% Increased in Damage
  • Zakudam Card, Zakudam Card, Magic Poison Plaga Card, Mutated White Knight Card,
 (1 + 0.1 + 0.1) x (1 + 0.3) x (1 + 0.25) x (1) = 1.95 or 195% Increased in Damage
  • Zakudam Card, Zakudam Card, Magic Poison Plaga Card, Magic Poison Plaga Card,
(1 + 0.1 + 0.1) x (1 + 0.6) x (1) x (1) = 1.92 or 192% Increased in Damage

So we can therefore conclude that using a maximum of 2 cards per modifier type is more effective than using 4 of the same cards.

Nova Ext / Game Commands and Settings

*beep boop* Did you know you can Visually see your range and spell slots with nova-ext? *boop beep* \(OWO)/

General Commands

▶These are all the useful and fully Nova-restricted customized commands that would help you and your Mage/Warlock Gameplay easier and better throughout the game.

In-game Commands
@Refresh Anti-Poslags Reloads displayed positions. (Removes Position Lag errors)
@Hotkey_# Hotkey Swapper Swaps you to another Hotkey for another build. (You have to buy slots in the Office)
@battlestats Character Status Displays in-depth character stats (Spell Slots / Modifiers / Casting Stats / Etc)
@nomelee Anti-Melee Prevents your cursor from targeting and accidentally walking to the mobs to melee it.
@restock Auto Restocking Restock allows you to automatically draw a set of registered items from your storage.
@showdelay Delay and Skill Failure Indicator Displays Cast Delay or Cooldown for skills
@spam Skill queueing Skill Queue system (Buffers skills used while on cooldown for the earliest available moment)
@view Hide Sprites @view_cart / marble / pet / hateffect / warg / flooritems / elemental

Nova-Ext Commands

In-Game Nova Ext Commands
/fps_unlock FPS booster uncaps your monitor refresh rate give you a huge fps boost (Important for mage users)
/timers Buff timers You can take track of Mage self buffs and may know when to re-cast it again.
/circle Range Indicator Since we have one of the highest range class in game, you may want to optimize range gameplay.
/box Range Indicator Same as /Circle but it's a box. (You can only have 1 Activated)
/m2e Effects Minimizer It visually minimizes effects, mostly used only if you are playing more on the performance side,
/fastrefresh Faster refresh rate Good for certain situations when you get stuck or cellbugged, but mostly used for teleporting fields.
/turbo Spammer macro tool Where your spamming consistency comes from.
POV:Nova Ext Settings of a Warlock User

  • For more info about NovaExt feel free to go to this page NovaExt
  • If you're having trouble with the system check this out Troubleshooting guide 
Important: Make sure that you enable and saved these commands by default in the settings of the NovaRO Launcher or at the NovaExt Configuration File and open it via Notepad (NovaExt.txt)
Miyu's Cheat Sheet for Range Indicators.

★ Type these Commands in-game!

▶ Box Range for the following skills: 

Crystal Impact (Climax 5) / Stasis
  • /box
  • /box_range15

▶ Box Range for the following skills: 

Frost Nova / Stone Curse
  • /box
  • /box_range3

▶ Box Range for the following skills: 

Frozen Slash
  • /box
  • /box_range7

▶ Circle Range for the following skills: 

Comet / Crimson Rock / Chain Lightning / Tetra Vortex / Frosty misty / Drain Life / Storm Gust (Release) / Marsh of Abyss 

Soul Expansion / Hell's Inferno / Earth Strain (Release) / Chain Lightning (Release) / Drain Life (Release) / Comet (Release) 

Crimson Rock (Release) / Jack Frost (Release) / Tetra Vortex (Release) / Gravitational Field / Ganbantein
  • /circle1
  • /circle1_range 15

▶ Circle Range for the following skills: 

Storm Gust / Quagmire / Lord of Vermillion / Meteor Storm / Mystery Illusion / Soul Vulcan Strike / Deadly Projection / Rain of Crystal 

Storm Cannon / Tornado Storm / Crimson Arrow / Rock Down / Floral Flare Road / All Bloom / Stratum Tremor / Violent Quake / Fire Wall 

Destructive Hurricane (Climax 5) / Jupitel Thunder / Sense / Waterball / Heaven's Drive / Earth Spike / Napalm Vulcan / Fire Pillar 

Safety Wall / Thunder Storm / Soul Strike / Fire Ball / Frost Diver / Napalm Beat / Cold Bolt / Lightning Bolt / Fire Bolt / Astral Strike / Ice Wall
  • /circle2
  • /circle2_range 10

▶ Circle Range for the following skills: 

Destructive Hurricane (Uniquely Range 6) /  Earth Strain (Uniquely Range 7) / Sighttrasher (Uniquely Range 8)
  • /circle3
  • /circle3_range 6-8

▶ Circle Range for the following skills: 

Sienna Execrate (Uniquely Range 11)
  • /circle4
  • /circle4_range 11

▷ Warning: This Range numbers are highly accurate only "if" you have Radius Skill level 3, Otherwise subtract the total range number by 3 (-3)
▷ Notes: This Are Maximum "Casting" Range (Cells in which you "Can" trigger or Activate the skill) Extended AoE's are not included/accounted.

Variable Cast Time Cards

Variable Cast Time
Item Item Type Total Value Effect Combo Effect
 Dark Illusion Card [Headgear] 10%
  • MaxHP -10%
  • MaxSP -10%
  • Reduce Variable Cast Time by 10%
Kathryne Keyron Card [Headgear] 12%
  • For every 1 refine, Reduce Variable Cast Time by 1%
  • If refine is +9 or higher, Matk +2%
 Tower Keeper Card [Headgear] 5%
  • INT + 1
  • Reduce Variable Cast Time by 5%.
 Blue Moon Loli Ruri Card [Headgear] 7%
  • Increases variable casting time by 5%.
  • Reduces variable casting time by 1% per refine rate of headgear.
  • If refine rate is 9 or higher, increases heal effectiveness by 3%.
  • If refine rate is 11 or higher, increases heal effectiveness by additional 5%.
 Corrupt Life Card [Headgear] 25%
  • When equipped with Phen Card, reduces variable casting time by 25%.
 Evil Nymph Card [Headgear] 10%
  • Reduces variable casting time by 15% when equipped with

Loli Ruri Card, Parasite Card, Miyabi Doll Card, Evil Nymph, Harpy Card, Bloody Butterfly Card,

 Grote Card [Headgear] 7%
  • Increases variable casting time by 5%.
  • Reduces variable casting time by 1% per refine rate of headgear.
  • If refine rate is 9 or higher, Mdef + 8, reduces magical damage taken from small size enemies by 1%.
  • If refine rate is 11 or higher, reduces magical damage taken from small size enemies by additional 2%.
 Ice Gangu Card [Headgear] 5%
  • Matk + 10, S.Matk + 1.
  • Increases water property magical damage by 4%, increases SP consumption of skills by 7%.
  • If refine rate is 9 or higher, increases water property magical damage by additional 3%.
  • If refine rate is 11 or higher, reduces variable casting time by 5%.
 Isilla Card [Headgear] 30%
  • INT +2.
  • Each magic attack has a 5% chance of reducing Variable Casting Time by 50% and +30 Flee for 5 seconds.
 Kathryn Wigner Card [Headgear] 5%
  • Reduces variable casting time by 5%.
  • When equipped with Spica Nerius Card and Nihil M. Heine Card, increase magical damage against small size enemies and brute race enemies by 7%.
  • When equipped with Wolf Lugenburg Card and Poe Richard Card, increase magical damage against medium size enemies by 7% and reduces global cool time by 5%.
 Pierrotzoist Card [Headgear] 7%
  • Increases variable casting time by 5%.
  • Reduces variable casting time by 1% per refine rate of headgear.
  • If refine rate is 9 or higher, increases ghost property magical damage by 1%.
  • If refine rate is 11 or higher, increases ghost property magical damage by additional 2%.
 Immortal Wind Ghost Card [Weapon] 10%
  • Reduces variable casting time by 10%, If Paired with Stephen Jack Ernest Wolf Card
 Greater Aries Card [Garment] 5%
  • Matk + 5.
  • Increases Wind Blade, Freezing Spear and Flaming Petals damage by 10%.
  • If refine rate is 7 or higher, reduces variable casting time by 5%.
 Arena Kuro Akuma Card [Footgear] 10%
  • Reduces variable casting time by 10%.
  • Increases Wind Blade, Freezing Spear, Flaming Petals damage by 15%.
  • Increases long ranged physical damage by 8%.
 Kuro Akuma Card [Footgear] 3%
  • Reduces variable casting time by 3%.
  • Increase Wind Blade, Freezing Spear, Flaming Petals damage by 5%.
  • Increases long ranged physical damage by 5%.
 Berzebub Card [Accessory] 30%
  • Reduce Variable Cast Time for skills by 30%.
 Kronecker G. Heine Card [Accessory] 10%
  • Reduce variable casting by 5%.
  • When equipped with Nihil M. Heine Card, reduce delay after skill by 3%.
 Mosquilo Card [Accessory] 7%
  • Reduces variable casting time by 7%.
  • Reduces attack speed (increases delay after attack by 3%).

If the headgear is upgraded to +9 or higher, MAtk +2%.

When dealing magic damage, there's a 0.5% chance that for 4 seconds your fixed cast time will be reduced by 50%.

Gives extra ATK + 5, MATK + 5 when equipping with Criatura Academy Hat.

 Grim Reaper Ankou Card [Headgear] 25% When receiving physical or magical damage, has a chance to curse all enemies in 17x17 cells around the user, Atk + 25% and Matk + 25% for 10 seconds.

The probability shall increase depend on refine rate. Transforms into Grim Reaper Ankou for 5 seconds when using First Aid.

For each 2 refine, MATK +1%, MaxHP - 1%.

Mage
[ Skill ] [ Type ] [ Properties ] [ Description ]
Sight Support
  • Max Level: 1
  • Target: Self
  • SP Cost: 10
 Reveals all hidden enemies in a 7x7 area around the caster for 10 seconds.
Napalm Beat Damage
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Enemy
  • SP Cost: 8 + (Skill Level)
  • Var. Cast Time: 0.4s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.1s
  • Cast Delay:
    • (Lv 1~3) : 1.0s
    • (Lv 4~5) : 0.9s
    • (Lv 6~7) : 0.8s
    • (Lv 8) : 0.7s
    • (Lv 9) : 0.6s
    • (Lv 10) : 0.5s
  • Range: 9
 Deal Ghost property magic damage to a target and all other enemies in a 3x3 area around them.


  • [Lv 1] : 80% MATK.
  • [Lv 2] : 90% MATK.
  • [Lv 3] : 100% MATK.
  • [Lv 4] : 110% MATK.
  • [Lv 5] : 120% MATK.
  • [Lv 6] : 130% MATK.
  • [Lv 7] : 140% MATK.
  • [Lv 8] : 150% MATK.
  • [Lv 9] : 160% MATK.
  • [Lv10] : 170% MATK.
Cold Bolt Damage
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Enemy
  • SP Cost: 12 ~ 30
  • Var. Cast Time: 0.64s ~ 3.2s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.16s ~ 1.2s
  • Cast Delay: 1.4s
  • Range: 9
 Strike a single target with bolts of ice from the sky.


  • [Lv 1] : 100% MATK, 1 Bolt.
  • [Lv 2] : 100% MATK, 2 Bolts.
  • [Lv 3] : 100% MATK, 3 Bolts.

Stone Curse Support
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Enemy
  • SP Cost: 26 - (Skill Level)
  • Var. Cast Time: 0.8s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.2s
  • Range: 2
  • Consumes: 1  Red Gemstone
 Attempt to apply the Stone Curse status affect to a target at chance.

Successfully Stone Curse'd targets will be unable to attack or cast skills for a few seconds, then become immobile and into Earth 1 element.

Re-casting this skill on a Stone Cursed target will remove the status from them.


  • When skill level is 6 or higher, it only consumes the  Red Gemstone on successful casts.


  • [Lv 1] : 24% Chance.
  • [Lv 2] : 28% Chance.
  • [Lv 3] : 32% Chance.
  • [Lv 4] : 36% Chance.
  • [Lv 5] : 40% Chance.
  • [Lv 6] : 44% Chance.
  • [Lv 7] : 48% Chance.
  • [Lv 8] : 52% Chance.
  • [Lv 9] : 56% Chance.
  • [Lv10] : 60% Chance.
Fire Bolt Damage
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Enemy
  • SP Cost: 10 + (2 x Skill Level)
  • Var. Cast Time: 0.64s ~ 3.2s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.16s ~ 1.2s
  • Cast Delay: 1.4s
  • Range: 9
 Strike a single target with bolts of fire from the sky.


  • [Lv 1] : 100% MATK, 1 Bolt.
  • [Lv 2] : 100% MATK, 2 Bolts.
  • [Lv 3] : 100% MATK, 3 Bolts.

  • [Lv10] : 100% MATK, 10 Bolts.

Increase SP Recovery Passive
  • Max Level: 10
 Naturally restore SP every 10 seconds. Also increase the amount of SP healed from consumables.


  • [Lv 1] : Restore (3 SP + 0.2%) Max SP every 10 seconds, Receive 2% more SP from consumables.
  • [Lv 2] : Restore (6 SP + 0.4%) Max SP every 10 seconds, Receive 4% more SP from consumables.
  • [Lv 3] : Restore (9 SP + 0.6%) Max SP every 10 seconds, Receive 6% more SP from consumables.
  • [Lv 4] : Restore (12 SP + 0.8%) Max SP every 10 seconds, Receive 8% more SP from consumables.
  • [Lv 5] : Restore (15 SP + 1.0%) Max SP every 10 seconds, Receive 10% more SP from consumables.
  • [Lv 6] : Restore (18 SP + 1.2%) Max SP every 10 seconds, Receive 12% more SP from consumables.
  • [Lv 7] : Restore (21 SP + 1.4%) Max SP every 10 seconds, Receive 14% more SP from consumables.
  • [Lv 8] : Restore (24 SP + 1.6%) Max SP every 10 seconds, Receive 16% more SP from consumables.
  • [Lv 9] : Restore (27 SP + 1.8%) Max SP every 10 seconds, Receive 18% more SP from consumables.
  • [Lv10] : Restore (30 SP + 2.0%) Max SP every 10 seconds, Receive 20% more SP from consumables.
Soul Strike Damage
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Enemy
  • SP Cost: 16 + (2 x Skill Level)
  • Var. Cast Time: 0.4s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.1s
  • Cast Delay: 1.4s
  • Range: 9
 Inflict multiple hits of Ghost property magic damage to a single target.


  • [Lv 1] : 100% MATK, 1 Hit, +5% MATK against Undead enemies.
  • [Lv 2] : 100% MATK, 1 Hit, +10% MATK against Undead enemies.
  • [Lv 3] : 100% MATK, 2 Hit, +15% MATK against Undead enemies.
  • [Lv 4] : 100% MATK, 2 Hit, +20% MATK against Undead enemies.
  • [Lv 5] : 100% MATK, 3 Hit, +25% MATK against Undead enemies.
  • [Lv 6] : 100% MATK, 3 Hit, +30% MATK against Undead enemies.
  • [Lv 7] : 100% MATK, 4 Hit, +35% MATK against Undead enemies.
  • [Lv 8] : 100% MATK, 4 Hit, +40% MATK against Undead enemies.
  • [Lv 9] : 100% MATK, 5 Hit, +45% MATK against Undead enemies.
  • [Lv10] : 100% MATK, 5 Hit, +50% MATK against Undead enemies.
Frost Diver Damage
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Enemy
  • SP Cost: 26 - (Skill Level)
  • Var. Cast Time: 0.64s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.16s
  • Cast Delay: 0.5s
  • Range: 9
 Inflict Water property magic damage to a single target with a chance to leave them frozen.


  • Frozen enemies are immobile, unable to cast skills and turn to Water 1 element.


  • [Lv 1] : 110% MATK, 38% Chance to apply Frozen status to target.
  • [Lv 2] : 120% MATK, 41% Chance to apply Frozen status to target.
  • [Lv 3] : 130% MATK, 44% Chance to apply Frozen status to target.
  • [Lv 4] : 140% MATK, 47% Chance to apply Frozen status to target.
  • [Lv 5] : 150% MATK, 50% Chance to apply Frozen status to target.
  • [Lv 6] : 160% MATK, 53% Chance to apply Frozen status to target.
  • [Lv 7] : 170% MATK, 56% Chance to apply Frozen status to target.
  • [Lv 8] : 180% MATK, 59% Chance to apply Frozen status to target.
  • [Lv 9] : 190% MATK, 62% Chance to apply Frozen status to target.
  • [Lv10] : 200% MATK, 65% Chance to apply Frozen status to target.
Fire Ball Damage
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Enemy
  • SP Cost: 25
  • Var. Cast Time: 0.8s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.2s
  • Cast Delay: 0.7s
  • Range: 9
 Launch a Fire Ball at an enemy, dealing Fire property magic damage to the target, and a lesser amount of Fire property magic damage to all enemies within a 5x5 area around them.


  • [Lv 1] : 160% MATK (Target), 120% (Area Damage).
  • [Lv 2] : 180% MATK (Target), 135% (Area Damage).

  • [Lv 7] : 280% MATK (Target), 210% (Area Damage).
  • [Lv 8] : 300% MATK (Target), 225% (Area Damage).

  • [Lv10] : 340% MATK (Target), 255% (Area Damage).
Thunderstorm Damage
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Ground
  • SP Cost: 24 + (5 x Skill Level)
  • Var. Cast Time: 0.64s ~ 4.5s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.16s ~ 1.5s
  • Cast Delay: 2.0s
  • Range: 9
 Call forth a storm of lightning on a 5x5 targeted location, all enemies inside will be hit by Wind property magic damage multiple times.


  • [Lv 1] : 100% MATK, 1 Hit.
  • [Lv 2] : 100% MATK, 2 Hits.
  • [Lv 3] : 100% MATK, 3 Hits.
  • [Lv 4] : 100% MATK, 4 Hits.
  • [Lv 5] : 100% MATK, 5 Hits.
  • [Lv 6] : 100% MATK, 6 Hits.
  • [Lv 7] : 100% MATK, 7 Hits.
  • [Lv 8] : 100% MATK, 8 Hits.

Safety Wall Support
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Ground
  • SP Cost:
    • (Lv 1~3) : 30
    • (Lv 3~6) : 35
    • (Lv 7~10) : 40
  • Var. Cast Time: 4.4 - (4 x Skill Level)
  • Fixed Cast Time:
    • (Lv 1) : 0.8
    • (Lv 2) : 0.72
    • (Lv 3) : 0.64
    • (Lv 4) : 0.56
    • (Lv 5) : 0.48
    • (Lv 6) : 0.40
    • (Lv 7) : 0.32
    • (Lv 8) : 0.24
    • (Lv 9) : 0.16
    • (Lv 10) : 0.08
  • Cast Delay: Roughly 0.3s at every level
  • Consumes: 1  Blue Gemstone
 Create a barrier on the ground that blocks all melee physical attacks.

The barrier will break after so many hits or if it recieves a hit the exceed its durability.


  • Can not be cast next to Pneuma.


  • [Lv 1] : 300 Base durability, Blocks 2 hits, Duration 5 seconds.
  • [Lv 2] : 600 Base durability, Blocks 3 hits, Duration 10 seconds.
  • [Lv 3] : 900 Base durability, Blocks 4 hits, Duration 15 seconds.
  • [Lv 4] : 1200 Base durability, Blocks 5 hits, Duration 20 seconds.
  • [Lv 5] : 1500 Base durability, Blocks 6 hits, Duration 25 seconds.
  • [Lv 6] : 1800 Base durability, Blocks 7 hits, Duration 30 seconds.
  • [Lv 7] : 2100 Base durability, Blocks 8 hits, Duration 35 seconds.
  • [Lv 8] : 2400 Base durability, Blocks 9 hits, Duration 40 seconds.
  • [Lv 9] : 2700 Base durability, Blocks 10 hits, Duration 45 seconds.
  • [Lv10] : 3000 Base durability, Blocks 11 hits, Duration 50 seconds.


Durability is based on the following formula;
Durability (HP) = Base_Durability + 7000 × (1 + 0.1 × Job_Level ÷ 50) + 65 × INT + Max_SP

Fire Wall Damage
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Ground
  • SP Cost: 40
  • Var. Cast Time: 1.6s ~ 0.64s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.4s ~ 0.06s
  • Range: 9
 Create a 1x3 wall of fire on the ground that deals Fire property magic damage to all enemies that walk into it.

Enemies damaged by the Fire Wall will be knocked back 2 cells.

After a cell in the wall deals damage a certain number of time, it will disappear.


  • Undead race and Boss monsters take all hits at once and are not affected by the knock back of this skill.
  • A maximum of 3 fire walls can be created at a time.


  • [Lv 1] : 50% MATK, Deal damage 3 times, Duration 5 seconds.
  • [Lv 2] : 50% MATK, Deal damage 4 times, Duration 6 seconds.
  • [Lv 3] : 50% MATK, Deal damage 5 times, Duration 7 seconds.
  • [Lv 4] : 50% MATK, Deal damage 6 times, Duration 8 seconds.
  • [Lv 5] : 50% MATK, Deal damage 7 times, Duration 9 seconds.
  • [Lv 6] : 50% MATK, Deal damage 8 times, Duration 10 seconds.
  • [Lv 7] : 50% MATK, Deal damage 9 times, Duration 11 seconds.
  • [Lv 8] : 50% MATK, Deal damage 10 times, Duration 12 seconds.
  • [Lv 9] : 50% MATK, Deal damage 11 times, Duration 13 seconds.
  • [Lv10] : 50% MATK, Deal damage 12 times, Duration 14 seconds.
Energy Coat Support
  • Platinum Skill
  • Max Level: 1
  • Target: Self
  • SP Cost: 30
  • Fixed Cast Time: 5.0s
 Use your SP as a shield to reduce damage from all incoming sources.

The closer your SP is to maximum, the higher the damage reduction, but more SP will be consumed every hit as well.


  • [Remaining SP 81~100%]: -30% Damage taken, 3% SP Consumed every time you take damage.
  • [Remaining SP 61~ 80%]: -24% Damage taken, 2.5% SP Consumed every time you take damage.
  • [Remaining SP 41~ 60%]: -18% Damage taken, 2% SP Consumed every time you take damage.
  • [Remaining SP 21~ 40%]: -12% Damage taken, 1.5% SP Consumed every time you take damage.
  • [Remaining SP 1 ~ 20%]: -6% Damage taken, 1% SP Consumed every time you take damage.
 Wizard Skill Tree
Wizard
[ Skill ] [ Type ] [ Properties ] [ Description ]
Soul Drain Passive
  • Max Level: 10
 Increases Max SP, and whenever you defeat a non-player enemy with a magical attack you recover some SP.


  • [Lv 1] : +2% Max SP.
  • [Lv 2] : +4% Max SP.
  • [Lv 3] : +6% Max SP.
  • [Lv 4] : +8% Max SP.
  • [Lv 5] : +10% Max SP.
  • [Lv 6] : +12% Max SP.
  • [Lv 7] : +14% Max SP.
  • [Lv 8] : +16% Max SP.
  • [Lv 9] : +18% Max SP.
  • [Lv10] : +20% Max SP.


When you defeat a non-player enemy with a magical attack, recover SP equal to:
(Enemy Base Level × ((95 + (15 × Soul Drain Level))) / 100)

Magic Crasher Damage
  • Max Level: 1
  • Target: Enemy
  • SP Cost: 8
  • Var. Cast Time: 0.24s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.06s
  • Cast Delay: 0.3s
  • Range: 9
 Strike an enemy with a weapon property physical attack, but you use your MATK instead of ATK for damage.


  • This attack uses the enemies DEF instead of Mdef.
  • This is considered a Ranged Physical Attack.

  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Self
  • SP Cost: 30 + (5 x Skill Level)
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.7s
 Amplify your magical damage for the next 60 seconds.


  • [Lv 1] : +5% MATK.
  • [Lv 2] : +10% MATK.
  • [Lv 3] : +15% MATK.
  • [Lv 4] : +20% MATK.
  • [Lv 5] : +25% MATK.
  • [Lv 6] : +30% MATK.
  • [Lv 7] : +35% MATK.
  • [Lv 8] : +40% MATK.
  • [Lv 9] : +45% MATK.
  • [Lv10] : +50% MATK.
Napalm Vulcan Damage
  • Max Level: 5
  • Target: Enemy
  • SP Cost: (15 x Skill Level) - 5
  • Var. Cast Time: 0.8s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.2s
  • Cast Delay: 0.5s
  • Cooldown: 1.0s
  • Range: 9
 Strike a target and all enemies in a 3x3 area around them for Ghost property magic damage.

Additionally, there is a chance to inflict the Curse status on targets hit.


  • This skills damage is increased based on the casters Base Level.


  • [Lv 1] : 70% MATK, 1 Strike, 5% Chance to apply Curse status.
  • [Lv 2] : 140% MATK, 2 Strikes, 20% Chance to apply Curse status.
  • [Lv 3] : 210% MATK, 3 Strikes, 15% Chance to apply Curse status.
  • [Lv 4] : 280% MATK, 4 Strikes, 20% Chance to apply Curse status.
  • [Lv 5] : 350% MATK, 5 Strikes, 25% Chance to apply Curse status.
Ganbantein Support
  • Max Level: 1
  • Target: Ground
  • SP Cost: 40
  • Fixed Cast Time: 3.0s
  • Cast Delay: 5.0s
  • Range: 18
  • Consumes: 1  Yellow Gemstone
  • Consumes: 1  Blue Gemstone
 Clear a 3x3 area of any ground effects.


  • This skill removes Land Protector.
  • This skill is not affected by effects which remove or lower gemstone costs.
Gravitation Field Support
  • Max Level: 5
  • Target: Ground
  • SP Cost: (20 x Skill Level)
  • Variable Cast Time: 5.0s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 1.0s
  • Cast Delay: 1.0s
  • Cooldown: 5.0s
  • Range: 18
 Create a 5x5 area of effect with intensified gravity that deals Neutral property magic damage.


  • This skills damage is increased based on the caster's Base Level.


  • [Lv 1] : 100% MATK, Hits 2 times.
  • [Lv 2] : 200% MATK, Hits 4 times.
  • [Lv 3] : 300% MATK, Hits 6 times.
  • [Lv 4] : 400% MATK, Hits 8 times.
  • [Lv 5] : 500% MATK, Hits 10 times.


Note: The final damage formula is:
Damage = [Skill Lvl × MATK × (# of hits) × (Base Level / 100)]

Fire Pillar Damage
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Ground
  • SP Cost: 75
  • Var. Cast Time: 1.92s - (0.192 x Skill Level)
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.48s - (0.048 x Skill Level)
  • Cast Delay: 1.0s
  • Range: 9
 Set a 3x3 trap on the ground that deals Fire property magic damage to any enemy that steps on it.


  • This skill seems to ignore MDEF (Unconfirmed).
  • You can not place a Fire Pillar within 3 cells of an ally or enemy.
  • You can have up to 5 Fire Pillars set at once.


  • [Lv 1] : 70% MATK, 3 Hits, Duration 30 seconds.
  • [Lv 2] : 70% MATK, 4 Hits, Duration 30 seconds.
  • [Lv 3] : 70% MATK, 5 Hits, Duration 30 seconds.
  • [Lv 4] : 70% MATK, 6 Hits, Duration 30 seconds.
  • [Lv 5] : 70% MATK, 7 Hits, Duration 30 seconds.
  • [Lv 6] : 70% MATK, 8 Hits, Duration 30 seconds.
  • [Lv 7] : 70% MATK, 9 Hits, Duration 30 seconds.
  • [Lv 8] : 70% MATK, 10 Hits, Duration 30 seconds.
  • [Lv 9] : 70% MATK, 11 Hits, Duration 30 seconds.
  • [Lv10] : 70% MATK, 12 Hits, Duration 30 seconds.
Sightrasher Damage
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Self
  • SP Cost: 33 + (2 x Skill Level)
  • Var. Cast Time: 0.32s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.08s
  • Cast Delay: 2.0s
  • Required status: Sight
 Blast fire balls outward from you in all directions, reaching up to 7 cells away.

Enemies in range are knocked back 2 cells, and take Fire property magic damage.


  • This skill requires you to be in Sight status, and ends Sight status after using this skill.


  • [Lv 1] : 120% MATK.
  • [Lv 2] : 140% MATK.
  • [Lv 3] : 160% MATK.
  • [Lv 4] : 180% MATK.
  • [Lv 5] : 200% MATK.
  • [Lv 6] : 220% MATK.
  • [Lv 7] : 240% MATK.
  • [Lv 8] : 260% MATK.
  • [Lv 9] : 280% MATK.
  • [Lv10] : 300% MATK.
Jupitel Thunder Damage
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Enemy
  • SP Cost: 17 + (3 x Skill Level)
  • Var. Cast Time: 1.6s ~ 3.8s
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0.5s
  • Range: 9
 Release a ball of lightning at a single target dealing Wind property magic damage and knocking them back.


  • [Lv 1] : 100% MATK, 3 Hits, 2 Cell knock back.
  • [Lv 2] : 100% MATK, 4 Hits, 3 Cell knock back.
  • [Lv 3] : 100% MATK, 5 Hits, 3 Cell knock back.
  • [Lv 4] : 100% MATK, 6 Hits, 4 Cell knock back.
  • [Lv 5] : 100% MATK, 7 Hits, 4 Cell knock back.
  • [Lv 6] : 100% MATK, 8 Hits, 5 Cell knock back.
  • [Lv 7] : 100% MATK, 9 Hits, 5 Cell knock back.
  • [Lv 8] : 100% MATK, 10 Hits, 6 Cell knock back.
  • [Lv 9] : 100% MATK, 11 Hits, 6 Cell knock back.
  • [Lv10] : 100% MATK, 12 Hits, 7 Cell knock back.
Water Ball Damage
  • Max Level: 5
  • Target: Enemy
  • SP Cost:
    • (Lv 1~2) : 15
    • (Lv 3~4) : 20
    • (Lv 5) : 25
  • Var. Cast Time: 0 + (0.64 x Skill Level)
  • Fixed Cast Time: 0 + (0.16 x Skill Level)
  • Range: 9
  • Requires standing on a water cell
 Draw water from the ground to summon a Water Ball to throw at a target, using an area around you to strike an enemy many times for Water property magic damage.

The target will be hit 1 time for every Water cell used around you.


  • You can use a Sage's Deluge or a Ninja's Watery Evasion for this attack, but the ground effect on each cell is removed for each strike of Water Ball.


  • [Lv 1] : 130% MATK, Uses a 1x1 Area of water.
  • [Lv 2] : 160% MATK, Uses a 3x3 Area of water.
  • [Lv 3] : 190% MATK, Uses a 3x3 Area of water.
  • [Lv 4] : 220% MATK, Uses a 5x5 Area of water.
  • [Lv 5] : 250% MATK, Uses a 5x5 Area of water.
Ice Wall Support
  • Max Level: 10
  • Target: Ground
  • SP Cost: 20
  • Range: 9
 Create a wall of ice (1x5 area, centered on the targeted cell) which prevents anyone from walking through the area.


  • Ice Walls have 400 ~ 2200 HP, 0 DEF, 0 MDEF, and their HP decreases by 50 every second.
  • Ice Walls can be attacked by yourself, allies and enemies.


  • [Lv 1] : 400 HP.
  • [Lv 2] : 600 HP.
  • [Lv 3] : 800 HP.
  • [Lv 4] : 1000 HP.
  • [Lv 5] : 1200 HP.
  • [Lv 6] : 1400 HP.
  • [Lv 7] : 1600 HP.
  • [Lv 8] : 1800 HP.
  • [Lv 9] : 2000 HP.
  • [Lv10] : 2200 HP.
