Shadow / Costume Stones
▶ Upper:  Magic Power Amber [U]

▶ Lower:  Magic Power Amber [L]

▶ R Hand:
+10  Magic Exorcist Corrupt Shadow Gauntlet
or
+10  Magic Executioner Holy Water Shadow Gauntlet
or
Any Other Race Specific Gauntlet's

▶ Garment:  Casting Onyx [G]

▶ R Acc: +10  Tempest Shadow Focus

▶ Mid:  Magic Power Amber [M]

▶ Armor:
+10  Magic Fishing Insect Net Shadow Robe
or
+10  Magic Scissor Hunting Shadow Armor
or
Any Other Race Penetration Armor's

▶ L Hand: +10  Tempest Shadow Shield

▶ Footgear: +10  Tempest Shadow Shoes

▶ L Acc: +10  Tempest Shadow Brooch

▶ CARDS
Upper:  Lichtern Yellow Card
Mid:  Fulgor Card
Low: -
Armor:  Sweet Nightmare Card or  Agav Card or (Any Element Armor Enchant Card)
R Hand:  Mutated White Knight Card x2
L Hand:  Mutated Khalitzburg Card
Garment:  Arc Elder Card
Footgear:  Nightmare Verit Card
R Acc:  Mavka Card
L Acc:  Mavka Card


Stats:

STR: 10 ▷ (Again If you're planning to put this on 0, i am advising you to atleast get x10 Gym passes to compensate for weights)
AGI: 120 ▷ (With the right amount of consumables and party buffs you should be able to get 190+ ASPD)
VIT: 100 ▷ Focus me 3rd (Tanky enough for End-game instances)
INT: 120 ▷ Focus me 1st (Damage/x1 Casting)
DEX: 120 ▷ Focus me 2nd (x2 Casting)
LUK: 59 ▷ (A few more punches of raw Matk)

▶ Enchants

Equipments Enchants

 Thanos Magic Helmet-LT [1]

  •  Magic Essence Lv. 1 ~ 3
  •  Gray Spell (Magic) Lv. 1 ~ 3

 Blue Crystal Staff-LT [2]

1st Line Enchant

  • MATK + 5 ~ 45
  • Variable Casting time 5 ~ 20%
  • Increases Earth Property Magical Damage by 3 ~ 15%

2nd Line Enchant

  • MATK + 3 ~ 7%
  • ACD + 1 ~ 5%
  • Increases Magical Damage against Normal Monsters by 5 ~ 20%
  • Increases Magical Damage against Boss Monsters by 5 ~ 20%

 Thanatos Two-handed Staff-AD [2]

1st Line Enchant

  • ACD + 1 ~ 5%
  • Variable Casting time 5 ~ 10%
  • Increase Magic Damage to Undead Property by 1 ~ 20%

2nd Line Enchant

  • MATK + 3 ~ 7%
  • Increases Magical Damage against Normal Monsters by 5 ~ 10%
  • Increases Magical Damage against Boss Monsters by 5 ~ 10%

 Hero Boots-LT [1]

  •  Knowledge of Wise Man
  •  Spell 1 ~ 4
  •  INT +1 ~ 5

 Temporal Int Manteau [1]

  • MATK+ 1 ~ 6%
  • Matk+ 5 ~ 40
  • Reduce After Cast Delay 3 ~ 15%

 Magical Booster [1]

  • Matk +3 ~ 5
  • Matk +1 ~ 3%

or

  • Reduces After Cast Delay 1 ~ 2 %
  • Reduces After Cast Delay 2 ~ 3 %

or a mix of both.

 Victory Wing Ears [1]

  • Reduces Delay After Skill by 1 ~ 3%
  • Reduces Delay After Skill by 1 ~ 3%

or

  • MATK + 1 ~ 10
  • MATK + 1 ~ 3%

or a mix of both.

 Deep Blue Sunglasses [1]

  • MATK + 1 ~ 3% x2

or

  • MATK + 1 ~ 10 x2

or a mix of both.

 Automatic Armor B-type [1]

  •  Automatic Module (Magic) x2
  •  Automatic Module (Shadow Spell)

or

  •  Automatic Module (Magic) x2
  •  Automatic Module (Delay after skill)

or

  •  Automatic Module (Shadow Spell) x2
  •  Automatic Module (Magic)

 Automatic Leg B-type [1]

  •  Automatic Module (Spell Buster)
  •  Automatic Module (Lucky Strike)
  •  Automatic Module (Fixed Casting)

 Brilliant Light Sapphire Ring [1]

  •  Happiness Lv 3 ~ 5
  •  Destructive Evil Lv 3 ~ 5

 Brilliant Light Sapphire Necklace [1]

  •  Happiness Lv 3 ~ 5
  •  Destructive Evil Lv 3 ~ 5

 Sinful Sapphire Ring [1]

  •  Horror Lv 3 ~ 5
  •  Dragon Scale Lv 3 ~ 5

 Sinful Sapphire Necklace [1]

  •  Horror Lv 3 ~ 5
  •  Dragon Scale Lv 3 ~ 5

▶ Skills

Rock Down Skill Build Notes 
Mage

  • This Skill Build focuses on Total SP and SP Generations as well as Safetywall, the rest are just pre-requisite counts.
Wizard

  • This Skill Build focuses on Fire pillar,Frost Nova and Mystical Amplification, Soul Drain as well to compensate sp lost.
Warlock

  • This Skill Build focuses on Itense Telekenesis to buff 4th job skill, Drain life for Sustainability and comet for debuff only.
Archmage

  • This Skill Build is focused on the Entire Earth skill tree + Soul Vulcan Strike as alternative damage, Deadly projection against Magic immunities and Frozen slash for AP recovery when idle.(no enemies)
Late Game [ Rock Down ]

Gameplay

Warlock / Arch Mage Showcase

Sprites / Outfits / Palettes

Are nya feeling fancy?~ (◡‿◡✿)

Jandelaine (Stylist NPC).

Color Palettes

  • There are Currently a Palette color of 1 to 1323 to choose from.
  • Jandelaine Can be found in Every Major City of Midguard (He looks like a blue Bard)
  • Unlocking a single sprite will cost you 5,000 NP (Nova Points)

▷Alternatively
 Alternate Outfit Voucher from Cash-Shop / Player Vendings.
 EVT Alternate Outfit Voucher from Server Events / Anniversary Gifts.

Mage Class Palettes
Wizard Male Female
High Wizard Male Female
Warlock Male Female
Warlock (Alternative) Male Female
Archmage Male Female

Outfits / Alternate Sprites

  • There are Currently a Premium Palette color of 1 to 39 to choose from.
  • We also have a Premium Clothing dye that will cost you 2,500 NP (Nova Points)
  • Do note that Premium Color dyes will only apply to 3rd-Job class Sprites.

▷Alternatively
 Omni Clothing Dye from Cash-Shop / Seasonal Events Prizes / Player Vendings or Slot machines.

Warlock & Archmage
Default Alternate 4th Class

Male Female
Male Female
Male Female



Leveling

Please Double check if your guild has tax on you!

Eden Academy (New Leveling Tutorial System)

▶ A New version of start up leveling System has come to NovaRO Called the Eden Academy!
You can register to the Academy by following the entirety of Mom's Tutorial, or by heading to the Academy Main Building (izlude 143, 352)Copied! and talking to Receptionist Jolene (moc_para01 306,303)Copied! inside.


▶ Mom's Tutorial
→ After you created a character in the character selection, as soon as you enter in the game Select don't skip the tutorial. to proceed the tutorial Starting scene.
→ Her location whole be the first house at the left side after you type @go Prontera or by using the Warper NPC > Special Areas > Home.
→ Once you are done with Mom's Tutorial you may now proceed to the Eden Academy afterwards.


▶ How to Start at Eden Academy (Follow the steps below)
→ Navigate to Eden Academy (izlude 143, 352)Copied! (or type @go academy to teleport there). → Talk to Jolene (moc_para01 306,303)Copied!, the receptionist, to register. → Follow Jolene's (and subsequent NPC's) instructions.

  • The Eden Academy questline is well-designed and completely self-contained.
  • As such, a walkthrough would be of very little to no use, and would instead undermine the purpose of the tutorials.
  • Players are strongly advised to read all NPC conversations thoroughly and attentively, which would provide all vital information needed to complete the tutorial itself, as well as to progress later in the game.
  • This applies to returning, veteran players as well, as over time the game system and the server have evolved drastically.
  • If you are ever stuck in the tutorial, before asking for help, backtrack to the last NPC(s) and read the conversations closely again (some NPCs give more detailed instructions the second time you speak to them).

▶ For more Information about the Eden Academy check out this Page: Eden Academy

Criaturia Academy (Old Leveling Tutorial System)

▶ Old Version of Leveling Through Criaturia Academy. (I advise to do the Eden Academy instead, so you could progress your gears as well)

Leveling Stage: Novice

 Novice Package (Lv 01)
500  Novice Potion
1  Rental Halter Lead Box
5  Blessing Lv 10 Scroll
1  Intermediate Package 
[ You have now Unlocked the first free package ]
  • Level 1 - 17:
    • Talk to the Criaturia Academy Staff /navi izlude 122/207, drink the Apple Juice and talk to him again. You will receive EXP.
    • Head north, inside the building and register for the academy at the Academy Receptionist. You will receive EXP and some Potions.
    • Exit the building, and find the Shop Helper outside the Tool Shop /navi izlude 116/181. Talk to her repeatedly, and finish both of her requests.
    • Head to the Main Office, you're now ready to change into Magician.

Alternatively

  • You can do Mom's Home tutorial (when you enter the middle portal at first time, this should trigger it) and finishing the quest will turn you into a magician.

Leveling Stage: Magician

  • Level 17 - 30:
    • Get your first few job levels around Prontera, by killing Porings/Lunatics/Fabres. Spend them on Fire Bolt lv4.
    • Head to the Eden Group, and pick up the Spore Hunting Quest. The best map to hunt them is East of Payon. You should be able to kill them in one Fire Bolt. Stay here until you have maxed both your Fire Ball and Fire Wall
  • Level 30 - 55:
    • Head to the Orc Dungeon, walk around the map and kill groups of Orc Zombies using your Fire Ball and Fire Wall.
      • Look out for Drainliar's and Orc Skeletons, they walk faster than the Zombies. When in doubt, use your Fire Wall or a Fly Wing to protect yourself
        • Change to Wizard once you reached JobLv 50
 Intermediate Package (Lv 50)
250  Intermediate Potion
50  Novice Blue Potion
50  Novice Fly Wing
1  Veteran Package 
[ You have now Unlocked the second free package ]

Leveling Stage: Wizard

Casting is going to be Difficult at this point

  • Level 55 - 70:
    • Head back to the Orc Dungeon, same tactic as above.
  • Level 70 - 91:
    • Pick up your Eden Group Equipment Quest, for Wraiths and Evil Druids. You can also find a turn in board quest for them at the Mission [71 - 85] Board inside Eden, which is repeatable. I recommend staying here until 91, since the 86-91 Turn In quests are not suitable for casters
      • The tactic is the same as it was for Orcs, use your vertical Fire Wall and Fire Ball against them.
        • Use Fly Wing if a Mimic is nearby
  • Level 91 - 99:
    • Pick up the Turn in quests from the 91-99 Mission Boards in Eden, and do not turn them in.
      • Recommended quests: Solider, Freezer, Injustice, Rybio, Dark Priest, Stapo, Roween, Siroma, Mineral
        • This part can be very difficult without a good graps of Vertical Firewalling.

Leveling Stage: Rebirth

  • Once you have reached 99/50, head to the Main Office and change into High Novice
    • Kill a few Porings or other beginner monsters around Prontera to reach JLv 10.
  • Once you have changed into High Magician, turn in one of the 91-99 quests you had saved up. This should put you to JLv 50.
  • Change into High Wizard, begin the Cautios Village Quest and turn the 91-99 quests that you saved up in. You should reach, or get close to 99/70.
    • If you're missing a few levels, feel free to join any Gramps parties, continue your 91-99 Turn in Quests, or grind Magmarings outside Thor Dungeon.

Alternative method to instantly reach 3rd Job after Rebirth

  1. Pick up both 85-114 Gramps quests and complete them. You will most likely have to stay in Gramps even after reaching 99/50. Do not turn these in.
  2. Buy 6  Holy Water and 6  Blue Gemstone from the Tool dealer, then do the Cautious Village quest.
    • DO NOT turn in Cautious Village. Stop right after giving the last set of holy water and blue gemstone to the last NPC. DO NOT talk to Mumbaki afterwards.
  3. Rebirth and equip the novice items you got from the Criatura Academy, if you lost them buy a Knife from any Weapon Dealer.
  4. Reach Job level 10 and ascend to High 1st Job, below are some ways of reaching it.
    • Sloth Quest
    1. Go to Lasagna. @go 40
    2. Talk to Sloth, at (lasa_fild01 132, 374)Copied!, and pick up his quest.
    3. Kill 3 Red Plant and turn in the quest.
    • Killing Monsters
      • Go to Hidden Dungeon and kill Poring. Warper –› Dungeon –› Hidden Dungeon
      • Go to Culvert and leave the map, kill Hornet. Warper –› Dungeon –› Culvert
      • Go to Morocc @go 1 and go down one map, kill Condor and Picky.
  5. Turn in Cautious Village to hit job level 50 immediately and ascend to High 2nd Job.
  6. Turn in both Gramps quests to instantly reach levels 99/70, base and job respectively, and ascend to 3rd Job.
  7. Get some sleep, Gramps is on cooldown.
 Veteran Package (Lv 99)
250  Veteran Potion
100  Novice Blue Potion
50  Novice Fly Wing
1  Master Package 
[ You have now Unlocked the third free package ]

Leveling Stage: Warlock

Crimson Rock/Jack Frost and Comet are your new bestfriends
Time to hit up a Gramps party, or stick to the Eden Boards. You can find the recommend quests below for each board.

You can also try to solo Gramps once you feel strong enough, depending on the month's rotation. Teleport around, and spam Comet/Crimson/JackFrost from Spell books.

  • Level 100 - 110:
    • Desert Wolf: They move relatively slow, you can mob a bunch of them and kill them using your Frost Misty + Jack Frost combo. If you dont have them yet, you can try using Quagmire + Storm Gust on them while standing in Safety Wall. They are fire element.
      • Found outside Ice Dungeon
    • Pinguicula + Luciola Vespa: Earth/Wind element respectively. I'd recommend grabbing a Crimson Rock book for instant casting, since they move relatively fast.
      • Found outside Splendide.
    • Ice Titan + Snowier: These guys are both Water element, and move really, really slow. You can just Release Chain Lightning, or spam Soul Expansion and kite them. Spamming Lv10 Jupitel Thunder might work aswell. Look out for Gazetis, they attack from a range with high ASPD. If you happen to encounter them, you can freeze them or just teleport away. They also drop materials for INT and DEX foods, which can get you a little extra money.
      • Found at the 2nd and 3rd floor of Ice Dungeon.
  • Level 111 - 120:
    • Nepenthes + Centipede Larva: These guys are both Posion element. Nepenthes are immovable so you will have no problems, although every other monster on the map is aggressive and moves fast, so it's highly recommended to use Safety Wall and Frost Nova if you happen to get mobbed.
      • Found just East Of Midgard Camp
    • Venatu: This is where things get a little intense. Venatus can be 4 different element, one of them is Water, which can not be frozen. Try mobbing a bunch, use Jack Frost to freeze them then instantly cast Safety Wall to protect yourself from the Water ones. After that, cast an Amped Crimson Rock then release another one from book right after. Look out for Dimiks, they might interrupt your casting, so a Phen Card is highly recommended.
      • Found in Juperos dungeon
  • Level 121 - 130:
    • Isilla + Vanberk + Hodremlin: The first two guys pose zero threat since they move really slow. Mob, Jack Frost, Crimson Rock, simple as that. However, Hodremlins are quick, so you might need to use Safety Wall or Fire Wall to keep them away from yourself.
      • Found in Rachel Dungeon.
    • Red Ferus + Green Ferus: They move really fast, so you will have to rely on Releasing Crimson Rock although fire will not hit the Red one. To hit the Red Ferus, you will need to freeze them first using your Frost Nova/Jack Frost + Crimson Rock combo. And again, do not forget that you have Safety Wall and Frost Nova to protect yourself if they happen to get close.
      • Found in Abyss Lake Dungeon.
 Master Package (Lv 125)
250  Master Potion
150  Novice Blue Potion
2  Combat Rations 30m 
[ You have now Unlocked the last free package ]
  • Level 131 - 140:
    • One-Horned, Two-Horned, Rake and Antler Scarabas: This is where things get a little gear reliant. It is recommended to have fire damage boosting cards/gear, and a Pinguicula card (refer to the Equipment section). The first two guys are passive, but they will get aggressive once one of them is hurt. Safety Wall/Fire Wall, Mystical Amplification, Crimson Rock, and a second, released Crimson Rock if needed. Business as usual.
      • Found in Scaraba Dungeon.
  • Level 141 - 175:
    • Neo Punk + Big Bell + Big Ben: Remember how Mages used to level in Clock Tower Pre-Renewal? Well, this is pretty much the same, with higher HP monsters, and instead of Fire Bolt, you use Crimson Rock. The best way to kill these guys is using Vertical Fire Wall + Crimson Rock. If there are any Ridewords or Mimics around, teleport away or simply Safety Wall yourself and kill them.
      • Found in Nightmare Clock Tower Dungeon.
  • Level 175 - 190:
    • Illusion dungeons or Gramps lv 175-180:Grind level here till you reach atleast 180 then you can proceed to Ein3/Odin4
      • Found in Illusion Dungeons.
      • Found in Eden Office/@go Eden.
    • Green/Red/White/Purple Minerals + Toxious/Noxious/Abyssman: Once you get to lv 180, you'll able to unlock these two dungeons.
    • Frus + Skogul + Angelgoltz + Plasma: Also unlockable once reached lv 180, an Alternative farming spot besdies Ein3.
      • Found in Einbech Dungeon 3.
      • Found in Odin's Temple 4 / Odin's Past.
  • Level 190 - 200:
    • Ferus + Acidus + Mimics:Abyss Lake will be unlocked on lv 190, Once you get to level 190 you can now grind in Abyss lake dungeon all the way (you can still grind at Ein3/Odin4 as well if you want to have income along with grinding levels.
      • Found in Odin's Temple 4 / Odin's Past.
      • Found in Abyss Dungeon 4.
      • Found in Einbech Dungeon 3.

Leveling Stage: Arch Mage

You now have Access to Strongest Ghost magic + most of the AoE Spells


  • Level 200 - 220:
  • Rudus F4:
    • Giant Caput + Venedi + Dolorian + Deadre and Plagarion: this mobs doesn't hurt much and they are slow, can easily mob and kite these monsters.
      • Found in Rudus_4 sp_rudus3,380,42
  • Level 220 - 230:
  • Niflheim Dungeon F1:
    • Ghost cube+ Ludegal + Brutal murderer + Gan Ceann: This mobs are a bit dangerous but still kite-able
      • Found in Niflheim Dungeon, niflheim,149,124
  • Level 230 - 240:
  • Amicitia Lab F1-F2:
    • Amitera + Litus + Fillia + Vanilaqus + Lavaeter + Fulgor + Napeo and Galensis: Mobs here hit hard but also kite-able, they also break armor so becareful and use FCP or unbreakable enchant cards.
      • Found in Amicitia_Dungeon, ein_fild08,158,96
  • Level 240 - 250:
  • Niflheim Dungeon F2:
    • Grote + Disguiser + Blue moon loli ruri and Pierrotzoist: same as lv 220-230 but floor 2 (6-o clock portal)
      • Found in Niflheim Dungeon, niflheim,145,38
Congratulations you are now max level! [lv 250] (enjoy your free 4th job stat bonus)

Consumables / Essentials

What can i get for ya? i have all the finest potions! | (• ◡•)|

[ Consumables / Buffs / Essentials ] [ Obtained From ] [ Notes ]
 Concentrated Golden Syrup Potion Genetic Brewing or Player Market / Vending This is your bread, when in doubt always bring some along the way (these aren't heavy so you can bring alot)
 Concentrated Blue Syrup Potion Genetic Brewing or Player Market / Vending and this is your butter, you might want to bring some of these as well because mages eats alot of SP (these aren't heavy so you can bring alot)
 LV10 Blessing Scroll Daily Rewards or Player Market / Vending Situational , mostly used when solo-ing contents and helps you instant-cast alone or if you get dispelled.
 LV10 Agil Scroll Daily Rewards or Player Market / Vending Situational , mostly used when solo-ing contents and helps you instant-cast alone or if you get dispelled.
 LV5 Assumptio Scroll Daily Rewards or Player Market / Vending Situational , mostly used when you feel you aren't tanky enough for the job.
 Angelus Scroll Daily Rewards or Player Market / Vending Situational , mostly used when you feel you aren't tanky enough for the job.
 Angeling Scroll Daily Rewards or Player Market / Vending Situational , a Semi-all-in-one that includes Agi/Bless/Angelus buffs.
 Arc Angeling Scroll Daily Rewards or Player Market / Vending Situational , The ultimate all-in-one consumable that includes Agi/Bless/Assumptio/Angelus buffs.
 Enrich Celermine Juice Genetic Brewing or Player Market / Vending Berserk potion's bestfriend, these helps you gain more ASPD if you are still lacking.
 Berserk Potion Tool Dealer NPC One of your main source of ASPD and can be easily obtained through Tool dealer (Make sure to buy it which merchant discount skill on Max level)
 HP Increase Potion(Large) Genetic Brewing or Player Market / Vending We all know Mage's has one of the lowest HP pool in the game so this is always welcome to have.
 SP Increase Potion(Large) Genetic Brewing or Player Market / Vending This one is also Situational, other than increasing your max sp it also helps you regen passively.
 Guarana Candy Guarana Quest or Player Market / Vending Important to bring if you don't have Map equipment for agi up buff and aspd buff from Berserk potions.
 Blue Herb Activator Genetic Brewing or Player Market / Vending Must have, the only consumable who gives a huge amount of buff% but also expensive to buy so use it wisely.
 Token of Siegfried Master of Coin NPC @ 2nd Floor Main Office or buy from Player Market / Vending Must have, everyone is bound to die at some point and sometimes it can get you at time where you least expected. (bring some it can be a life changer)
 Peach Cake Red Mushroom Wine Mega Siroma Icetea Mega Warg Blood Cocktail +4 to +20 Stat Foods Sarah's Memory Instance, Genetic Brewing, or Player Market / Vending Basically free and can be farm easily on Sarah Instance so make sure to hoard some!
 INT Tonic DEX Tonic MH Expedition or Player Market / Vending Situational, Adds a few punches of INT to boost your dmg and most importantly used to instant-Cast if you are still lacking stat points.
 Guyak Pudding Speedy Gonzales NPC @ 1st Floor Main Office / @go woe top left or Player Market / Vending Warlocks don't have skill oriented Mounts or Movement speed increasing skills so this is as reliable as it can be.
 Speed Potion Speedy Gonzales NPC @ 1st Floor Main Office / @go woe top left or Player Market / Vending Same as Guyak buy they have the shortest duration (use it to make Guyak pudding's instead)
 Box of Drowsiness Player Market / Vending Used in Siege/PvP Area to add more raw Matk.
 Mothi's Blessing Player Market / Vending or From Event Goodie Bags Rare Consumable that you can also bring to add more Matk but use it only when going full effort.
 Cursed Fragment Tomb of Honor or Player Market / Vending Gives both debuff and buff when used, relatively easy to farm so bring some if you can.
 Rune Strawberry Cake Tripatriate Union's Feud quest or Player Market / Vending Rare consumable and also expensive, doesn't give as much Matk like others but it can be stacked amongs other buffs.
 Tyr's Blessing Player Market / Vending or From Event Goodie Bags Also a Rare consumable so use only on difficult situations.
 Herb of Incantation Player Market / Vending or From Event Goodie Bags Same effects as Cursed Fragment but doesn't require you to spam to get the buff
 Elemental Converters Master of Elements NPC @ 1st Floor Main Office or Player Market / Vending Mimics the Sorc Endow powers and gives you a small boost of elemental damage.
 Elemental Proof Potions Obtained by using

 Plasma Card, Genetic Brewing, or Player Market / Vending

Must have, Specially at end game instances where-in dps has small room for reductions in there gears slots.
 Imperfect Almighty Master of Coin NPC @ 2nd Floor Main Office A steroid and compiled version of Sarah's foods, great to have if you don't want to eat alot of foods if you recently died.
 Shining Defense Scroll 60m Master of Coin NPC @ 2nd Floor Main Office Must have, gives massive amount of def and mdef
 Gin Sacred Draught Master of Coin NPC @ 2nd Floor Main Office Optional, Gives both offensive and defensive buffs.
 Gin Rejuvenation Potion Master of Coin NPC @ 2nd Floor Main Office Must have, Makes you pot less if you regen HP faster
 Gin Potion of Energy Master of Coin NPC @ 2nd Floor Main Office Must have, always bring this it is a life saver for our sp problems!
 Red Booster Master of Coin NPC @ 2nd Floor Main Office Optional, If you are still lacking ASPD and Berserk and Celermine isn't enough this would help alot.
 Maniacal Potion Master of Coin NPC @ 2nd Floor Main Office Optional, If you are still lacking ASPD and Berserk and Celermine isn't enough this would help alot. (this gives the highest ASPD% amongs every token consumables)
 Gin Infinity Drink Master of Coin NPC @ 2nd Floor Main Office Must have, makes your casting uninterruptable and more assorted buffs.
 Gin Limited Power Booster Master of Coin NPC @ 2nd Floor Main Office Optional, Gives FCT yes you heard me right, and alot more assorted buffs.
 Shining Gin Potion Master of Coin NPC @ 2nd Floor Main Office The Jack of all Token buffs, same as other but just combined for easy usage and lesser cost.
 Shimmering Candy Seasonal Gift Boxes One of the best Consumables out there for us Mage/Magic Users.

Pets / Companion

Grwwwaaaaarrrrhh!? (o ╹ᵕ ╹ o)

Pets

▶ Having Pets allows you to bring a sidekick around as your companions. Aside from appearance, they also give varying bonuses depending on their intimacy level.
(Shy/Awkward > Neutral > Cordial > Loyal)

▶ Do note that each time you die, or when it is left untreated / unfed they will decrease in Intimacy so becareful!
▶ To activate the Automatic Feeding system, check the drop menu in the pet menu and click the Automatic Feeding to turn it on.
▶ Pets will be de-equipped or return to there eggs if you go to any Siege Maps or maps that has pets disabled, they are not allowed.
▶ Pets stats will help you fill on the gaps on your build if you lack something like (ASPD / ACD / MATK / STATS / VCT) 

Here are my Pet recommendations to you mages! so make sure to Increase there intimancy and become Loyal to make the most of the there Benefits
  •  Christmas Snow Rabbit:When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ Gain 5% experience from all enemies
  •  Elephant: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ DEX + 3
  •  Lion: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ INT + 3
  •  Willow: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ INT + 3
  •  Wanderer: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ Dex + 1 Agi + 3
  •  Roween: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ Increase damage inflicted by Wind Property magic by 3%
  •  Metaller: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ HP recovery + 20%, Max HP + 70, increases magical damage on Plant monsters by 6%.
  •  Leaf Lunatic: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ When intimacy is Loyal, CRI + 5, Atk + 5, increase magical damage against formless race monster by 6%.
  •  Ancient Mummy: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ Hit + 6, increases magical damage on Dragon monsters by 6%.
  •  Zealotus: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ increases magical damage against Demi-Humans by 2%.
  •  Child Admin Beta: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ increases magical damage against monsters in Lost Valley and Sewage Treatment Plant maps by 10%.
  •  Child Admin Alpha: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ increases magical damage against monsters in Magic Power Plant and Storage Tartarus maps by 15%.
  •  Earth Deleter: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ Increase attack speed (reduce delay after attack by 3%), Agi + 3.
  •  Aliot: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ increases attack speed (reduce delay after attack by 5%), Hit + 12.
  •  Kiel-D-01: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ increases attack speed (reduce delay after attack by 7%), Hit + 18.
  •  Miyabi Doll: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ INT +1 , Variable Cast Time - 3%
  •  Evil Nymph: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ Max SP +30 , SP Recovery + 8%
  •  Am Mut: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ MATK + 4%
  •  Abandoned Bear Doll: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ MAX SP + 150 , While dealing magical damage, small chance to restore 30 SP per second for 5 seconds
  •  Alicel: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ Reduces variable casting time by 5% , Increases neutral property magical damage by 5%
  •  Rigid Nightmare Terror: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ Int + 3 , Max SP + 1% , Gain immunity to Sleep
  •  Bacsojin: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ Max SP + 3% , Reduce delay after skill by 3%
  •  Gloom Under Night: When intimacy is Loyal, ▶ MATK + 40 , Increases ghost and fire property magical damage by 7%

Pros and Cons

You want some explosions dont you? (¬‿¬) 

Things that you should know what we're good and bad at.

Pros

  • Strongest AoE compare to other classes
  • Longest range amongs range classes
  • Has access to multiple Elements
  • Has access to good utilities
  • Has access to one of the strongest debuffs in the game (Comet's Magic intoxification)
  • They also have good amount of crowd controls
  • Preferred class to bring as a mobber/sweeper/cleaner on party runs
  • One of the Strongest DPS class in the game both PvM and PvP
  • Flashiest and the most destructive looking class in the game
  • Has the ability to bypass Magic immunities on late-game
  • Magic can't miss which makes it a great choice for high flee targets or enemies with guard, parry, defender, etc. (even enemies on pneuma/Safety wall)

Cons

  • One of the lowest Health Pool amongs other classes
  • Fully relies on MDEF Penetrations
  • Lack of Skill points to use more than 2 builds
  • Reflect is one of our worst enemies
  • Requires massive investments to become decent
  • Has alot of requisites on certain damage builds
  • Suffers on SP drains and SP debuffs
  • Skills are bound to element types so that strong skills or skills with a certain effect can't be used on every enemy
  • No movement enhance skills that makes them pretty slow compared to most classes
  • Expensive to gear since each skills needs its own set of equipment to make it powerful

Acronyms / Abbreviation / Terminology

What does UWU mean mom?

3rd Job Alternate Outfit WL
[ Shortcuts / Keywords ]
  • AMP= Mystical Amplification
  • ACD= After Cast Delay
  • CD= Cooldown
  • CD= Cast Delay
  • SW= Safety Wall
  • EC= Energy Coat
  • QM= Quagmire
  • CL= Chain Lightning
  • CR= Crimson Rock
  • SE= Soul Expansion
  • FM= Frosty Misty
  • SG= Storm Gust
  • JF= Jack Frost
  • ES= Earth Strain
  • TV= Tetra Vortex
  • IT= Intense Telekinesis
  • FS= Freezing Spell
  • GAN= Ganbantein
  • WL= Warlock
  • AM= Arch Mage
  • WIZ= Wizard
  • WI= White Imprison
  • MOA= Marsh of Abyss
  • DL= Drain Life
  • AoE= Area of Effect
  • ASPD= Attack Speed per second
  • BiS= Best in Slot
  • CC= Crowd Control
  • DEF= Defense
  • MDEF= Magic Defense
  • MOD= Modifier / Modification
  • DPS= Damage-Per-Second
  • FCT= Fixed Cast Time
  • VCT= Variable Cast Time
  • CB= Cast Bar
  • FT= Full Throttle
  • HP= Health Points
  • MATK= Magic Attack
  • Meta= Most Used / Abused
  • MH= Monster Hunter
  • PVM= Player vs. Monster
  • PVP= Player vs. Player
  • MVP= Most Valuable Player
  • Siege = PVP
  • SP= Spell Points/Spell Power/Mana
  • RES= Resistance

FAQ (frequently asked questions)

Why is the female mage not called Witch?... (・_・;)

[ Some Frequently Asked questions ]
▶ Is Mage Class fun to play? Yes
▶ Will i regret playing this class? No
▶ Are we on a better fit / Positon to the meta right now? Yes
▶ Is This class good at PvP [Siege] Contents as well? Yes
▶ Are Spellbooks Mandatory? Yes
▶ Can Mage's Levitate / Fly? No
▶ Can Mage's play Tank role? Yes
▶ Does it take more than 2 braincells to play and understand the class? Yes
▶ How many MATK should i get? Yes
▶ Should i use Release lvl 2? No
▶ Is Comet Necessary to get even at 4th jobs? Yes
▶ Are Mage's a good starter / Farmer Class to start with? No
▶ Is Magic Crasher good? No
▶ Can i use my Warlock gears to other magic classes? Yes
▶ Can i disregard Dex stat completely if i have 100% VCT? Yes
▶ Can i make my Mystical Amplification Insta-cast? No
▶ Can we still be decent without insta-cast? Yes
▶ Can Warlocks Alone Hunt MvPs? Yes
▶ Do we really need 100% Mdef Pierce to be useful? No
▶ Is 193 ASPD Necessary? Yes n't

  • Some Wiki Tables and such are borrowed from sources, for i have respectfully designed / improved it differently / uniquely and made my own kind and versions.
  • This class guide is still in work in progress, everything you see here can be replaced/adjusted depending on game updates.
  • This guide is based on my knowledge about the game, experience, opinion, and preference.
  • This article is just a guide. It's up to you if you will follow everything.
  • This guide will Assist you up from Mage until Archmage class
  • I'll try to keep this guide up to date as long as I still play the game.
  • There may be errors and/or inaccuracies in this guide. Feel free to contact me and correct me, and i would gladly appreciate it.
